description:
Go here! SHUT up! 
Walked in needing a snack.
This place does specials for the day, so one kind of pizza, and a few different types of bread, not sure on the cookies & pastries if those change up as well.
We had the pizza: shitake, crimini, garlic, olive oil, cheeses - NOM
1 ginger molasses cookie OMG
1 ? rounded almond cookie OOOOOMG
We bought more cookies and a wolferine sourdough bread to take home,
ate some toasted bread when we got home.
Also love that this is a worker owned coop.
They have all ingredients listed for everything so easy for allergy check.
We will be back!
author: Gabi M.

description:
Visited here per a friend's request, and I did not leave disappointed. I think they're most famous for their baked goods, but I came here to try their pizza.

Their pizza is good, but it's definitely not the best SF has to offer. It's one of those places that don't really use tomato sauce. There is however plenty of cheese, and the toppings of the day went pretty well with it. I think mine was artichoke, spinach, and onion. They have a wide variety of baked goods, which many people were lining up for. This made for an interesting experience in that I was eating pizza but my nose was overwhelmed by the smell of other baked goods.

They don't have much seating, but most people don't end up sitting there with their food anyway. People working there are super nice.
author: Priscilla S.

description:
Amazing! I love a scone here. 
Vegan scone was a little bit too sweet for me so I always get an automeal scone. 
Lots of vegan/gluten free options and I love it!
author: Saki ..

description:
The pizza is great pretty much the same as cheese board minus the extra slice and sauce.  The flavor of the day I had the pleasure of trying was Roasted Sweet Potato, Kale, Mozzarella, Goat Cheese, Ancho Pesto paste on top.   The crust here is almost identical to the OG across the bay as is the price. 
  I was oogling the baked goods while I waited in line which looked great, but was trying not to carb out too hard, well harder than a whole pizza.   Would like to come back to try other pizza flavors for sure.
author: Spencer W.

description: My recent obsession is the mexican chocolate muffin with a tiny hint of cayenne pepper mixed inside and the surprising chocolate morsel burst into the bite.  Moist.  Cheap. 2.50 without health tax or tax.  My pet peeve is that other bakery really add tax on top of tax and you end up paying extra on top of extras. I also love their slice of healthy pizza with veggie.  Who knew eating pizza can be healthy. When the pizza comes hot straight from the oven, oh oh so good that it burns the riif of your mouth good.  But i also see them just heating up already made pizza which is not so good but it still hits the spot. This place is too convenient and too dangerous for me not to drop by.
author: Helen L.

description:
Almost Cheeseboard quality pizza, for $2.50 a slice, in the Mission, AND they accept credit card?! Yes, yes, yes! This bakery is amazing, serving a decent variety of baked goods, but the big star here is the pizza!

They have one flavor a day, it's vegetarian, and it's probably good! The pizza I had was exquisite, with excellent quality cheese, great, robust flavors, and was just amazingly well crafted. I had two slices, and it came with that tiny bonus slice they do at Cheeseboard as well!

There wasn't much of a wait when I went, and I usually don't see much of a line, which is quite amazing cause there can be quite a wait at the other locations. Still, the quality is just as good if not better.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Cute coop with low prices and lots of vegan options.

Food: I tried the focaccia and the mint cookie, both of which were really great! The focaccia was very fluffy and savory, and the mint cookie was something I'd definitely return for!
Logistics: this place doesn't seem to be exactly at the address listed. It seems to be next door to that address. 
Service: great, but the place was crowded and people kept cutting me in line... I think I ended up waiting through ~3 lines because I'm not very assertive.
Atmosphere: super cute, very comfortable, and I love that it's a co-op. You should absolutely stop by here and support them!
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Having Arizmendi Bakery right next to my Bart station at 24th & Mission is very dangerous... It means that I'm always tempted to stop by and grab some pastries or a slice of pizza. I usually cave in. So far I've stopped by 3 times this week...

The pizza is amazing and wonderfully savory and delicious. Each day brings a new pizza recipe and I've never been disappointed. I usually get a slice for $2.75, which I feel is a reasonable price for what you're getting in return. They also have half and whole pizza options. I'd say that their pizzas are on-par with that of Cheeseboard in Berkeley, so if you're a fan of Cheeseboard you'll for sure love Arizmendi.

As for their pastries, I tried the Mexican Chocolate Muffin and a Pecan Roll. Both were great! The Mexican Chocolate Muffin is rich and also packs a little bit of spice - but not too much! The Pecan Roll was delicious as well - sweet and nutty! 

If you're in the Mission and need a slice of pizza or a pastry, be sure to stop here to get some extra carbs into your life!
author: Steven L.

description: I love pizza and this place is great for it in San Francisco. Sure this isn't cheeseboard but it's still good. It may be the same company in the background but it's not the same (and as good). One cool thing is that the pizza from the yesterday is only like ten bucks! That's a quality pizza that's huge and delicious for such a great deal. I bought this and flew it all the way back to Colorado and man was it good. So cheesy and delicious. As read by the other reviews, the crust is really not that good. They should learn something from cheeseboard. I also got the Mexican hot chocolate. It was soooo good. It was also soothing. I had a sore throat that day and the spices really soothed it. #kevinishappy
author: Kevin L.

description:
My boyfriend and I were just walking around Mission until I saw this huge store with a "Bakery" sign in front of it. As a pastry and sweets fanatic, I couldn't resist running inside to take a quick peek. When I came to this bakery it was maybe right after noon, so around 1 or 2 o'clock. There were still pastries on the shelves but some were starting and some had already run out! What I love about the pastries here is that they're delicious and not overwhelmingly sweet.

* Carrot Muffin *
I LOVE carrot cake so I had to give this one a try. This was my favorite pastry from today's pastry haul. It was unbelievably moist, perhaps the moistest carrot pastry I've ever had! What was really delicious was the textural contrast of the slightly crisp muffin top and the soft, fluffy interior. Yum!

* Blackberry Scone *
The scones here are ginormous and this blackberry scone was bomb. Normally I don't like scones because they tend to be like a dry brick but the ones here were actually moist inside! The blackberry flavor is also a really nice touch. 

* Cowgirl Cookie *
I love a good oatmeal cookie and this one is a really tough cookie to beat. Firm and crisp on the outside but soft and chewy when you bite into it. How do they do it!? SO GOOD!!! I love that it's not painfully sweet either.
author: Sylvia L.

description: A co-op bakery dishing out delicious sweet and savory baked goods. Everything, literally, is absolutely delicious. I love their adventurous flavor combos, like their Cornmeal Dried Cherry Scone or  California Corn, Red Onion, Feta, Mozzarella, and Salsa Verde Pizza. Never skip out on their "pizza of the day", which is put on their sourdough thin crust, and made to order. All of their locations are equally delicious in quality and flavor, and staff always super friendly. I love Arizmendi!
author: Adriana G.

description:
Stopped by this morning to pick up breakfast for a friend.

Originally thought I'd get croissants, but I was wrong to assume they had them (or they weren't on the shelves).

Ended up picking up a blueberry cornbread muffin and a bread pudding. Didn't try the blueberry cornbread muffin personally, but my friend said it was delicious! As for the bread pudding, that was great. It was a tad small, but it wasn't too dense or sweet, which I appreciated.

The bread pudding was more expensive than the muffin, but compared to most bakeries, the prices are much more reasonable ($2 something for the muffin and $3 something for the bread pudding).

Trying not to eat as much baked goods, but I'll definitely stop by again to try the muffin for myself, as well as their pizza (which I've heard good things about).
author: Jennifer W.

description: First time at the Mission co-op. Love the location and available outside seating! As always Arizmendi never disappoints when you're in the mood for a slice. The pizza of the day has a sourdough crust and comes w an extra half slice. Great for morning breakfast pastry options or taking home loafs for your family. They also have the full spectrum of any desired coffee drinks you may want. Love this place!
author: Diana L.

description:
Pizza and a baby slice. 

Came here to try their daily pizza. My friend and I ordered a half pizza and they split it into two packages. Each had two regular slices and an extra Baby slice! A pleasant surprise.  

Their daily pizzas change everyday, but it was really good. A nice thin crust and has good ingredients. 

They are a bakery so they have bread and other baked goods available for purchase.
author: Jacky C.

description: One of my favorite bakeries in the city. Favorites are the cheese rolls, vegan mint chocolate cookie, and cheddar jalapeno bread sticks, & foccacias. Plenty of options if you want vegan and gluten free goodies!
author: Jay L.

description:
I love Arizmendi Bakery! I'm lucky to live really close by, but I have to consciously stop myself from coming here everyday. It's closed on Tuesday so at least that's one day I can't come in. The sourdough bread here is awesome! I've never bought an entire loaf of fresh pre-sliced bread before coming here, and I don't think I can buy anything else from now on. The pizza is also super yummy, as are the baked goods!

The doors are always open which makes the place really inviting. There is a large table and a few other seats to sit and eat. I don't think it's really a place to camp out with your laptop since there's a constant flow of people coming in and out. I love the philosophy of the bakery and how friendly the staff is, just really glad to have this place in the city!
author: Mimi S.

description:
This is definitely my favorite neighborhood bakery in Mission.

I've come here multiple times and always always always come back. One, their single-flavor pizza is so dang good, fresh, and veggie-friendly! I daresay it's the Cheeseboard equivalent in SF. I'm so glad it's not crazy full and packed like Cheeseboard is--that's just my selfish foodie self talking. They also have the best pastries and baked goods, whether you are looking for a loaf of bread or huge cookies and my favorite--their flavorful scones...they're all there to please every customer. My boo likes their savory scones, and other baked goods like cheesy breads.

My favorite part is the service and wonderful vibes of Arizmendi. I always feel at peace and safe when I come here. All of the workers are gorgeous and work so efficiently. They believe in being kind to everyone and standing up to injustices with their strong social justice awareness. That's exactly the kind of business that I want to support...you know that phrase "you are what you eat." Delicious, reliable, and a champion baker in my heart!
author: Jodi H.

description: They have lot of goodies here. I like the loaded pizza and the other baked items they have. I think they only make a couple of types of pizza everyday and there is no big menu like other places. The last time I was there, they had the red onion, feta, fresh corn with mozzarella which was yummy. The almond cookies for dessert were good, the choc chip was just OK. Would have been a higher rating except for the grumpy lady at the counter who brought down the experience with her negative energy.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Went here on a Saturday afternoon per the recommendation of a local! I can't keep myself away from a good bakery with delicious pizza and coffee, so this was an easy choice.

Shared a fresh fruit scone, a blueberry snail, and a pecan swirl with hubs. The snail and the swirl were a little on the dry side, but that was the best tasting scone I have ever laid my teeth in. It was like a giant soft cookie with fresh fruit (I think apricot) inside. Just so yummy! And when paired with an iced latte, it made for an incredible mid-day treat. Highly recommend you try the scone as well as some espresso-based drink. 

The pizza also looked solid, but I can't speak to it because I didn't try it.
author: Chelsea S.

description:
I love arizmendis! This was my first time visiting the Valencia location. It's a much larger store front with outdoor seating by the curb. Large selection of pastries and they also serve the daily pizza. I recommend stocking up on the blueberry corn muffins and scones for breakfast. 

I had the broccoli pizza which has roasted potato, broccolini, cheddar, mozzarella, garlic olive oil, and chives. The pizza was good but a bit burned around the edges. they give you pretty generous slices. Still prefer the 9th Ave location which serves my favorites - the Pearl and portobello mushroom pizza. 

Overall, great place to grab a quick lunch or snack if you're in the mission area. Pizza is consistent and delicious.
author: Kristy L.

description:
I came here as part of a SF sourdough bread crawl and Arizmendi definitely had the most unique treats! I loved their chocolate & cherry sourdough bread, and I liked how you had the option to either choose a loaf or a small roll (portion control). The prices are SUPER reasonable; much cheaper than other bakeries. 

Came for the sourdough bread but stayed for the pizza, which reminded me a lot of Cheese Board's pizza in Berkeley (they were modeled after Cheese Board, so unsurprising). Really interesting vegetarian pizzas - the one that day was potato, basil, and cheddar. They give you a baby slice on top of a slice that you order, which is cute. 

There's not a ton of seating, but there's a nice perch outside the bakery to hang out while you munch on your carbs.
author: Denise L.

description:
Pizza
Pizza
Pizza
One veggie pizza with special sourdough crust served every day. Get a slice, half or whole pie.
They also have bakery fare: breads to scones, as well as equator coffee.

Pizza tends to run out by 6 something PM. They are credit card friendly and pretty efficient.

Try the pizza. It's like crack. I don't know what crack is like. But their pizza is addictive. I go there twice or thrice a week for a slice, before a walk down other wonders on Valencia (Garden Creamery) or the Mission (Tahini)
author: Sam K.

description:
Situated in a quiet corner on Valencia street, this bakery is fantastic. And so unlike the bakeries that it shares the street with (Cough cough, Tartine, cough cough) this place is the opposite of snobby. With misspelled signs and bread loaves galore, this place sings of the real mission, the one that came before the fancy coffee chains and minimalist clothing shops. This place seems like a real neighborhood joint. 

The not-uppity pastries are fantastic. Last time I was here, I tried the corn cherry scone it was out of this world. Their shortbread, and other cookies are also absolutely wonderful. Would highly recommend if one is looking to escape the crowds at places like Tartine and just wants some darn good bread.
author: Annika S.

description: The baked goodies here are delicious and very reasonably priced! I tried the strawberry rhubarb scone, which was very tasty but wish it had a bit more rhubarb. Their Mexican mocha is probably the best I've ever had! The cheddar jalapeno bread sticks are also very yummy. Will definitely be back and try more of their goodies.
author: Dan B.

description: This place has good baked goods but they call themselves a pizza place. They only serve one type of pizza a day and be warned- it is a weirdo slice. Last time I was here it was cauliflower something and then like twenty more ingredients. I can't tell you what they were because I got bored half-way through the list and stopped reading it. There is always a line here so be prepared for a little bit of a wait.
author: Kiana B.

description:
Food 3/5. Service 4/5. Ambiance 4/5.

Maybe it's the pastries I tried that I didn't like, but it just wasn't my favorite. I usually frequent the Arizmeni Bakery in Oakland, and most of them are delicious. 

I got the breakfast focaccia and the blueberry snail. First of all the breakfast focaccia isn't a focaccia and on top it's topped with cheese and baked inside it's some tomato and an egg. The egg was overcooked nor did it have much seasoning. Overall, the egg inside the "focaccia" is a fun idea for a pastry on the go, it just wasn't seasoned or cooked right. 

The blueberry snail was almost like a cinnamon roll but filled with blueberries and cream cheese instead. This tasted dry even with the cream cheese in the crevices. 

Even though the pastries aren't great, the pizza at this location is just as good! Overall, it's a good bakery to stop by. I'll probably stop by again to try other pastries. 

Tips - Unlike the bakery in Oakland, you don't have to spend more than $5.

Pro - A lot of pastries to choose from. There's great outdoor seating.

Cons - Doesn't really compare to the bakery in Oakland.
author: Brian N.

description:
On walking in, I was immediately greeted by the nose-tingling aroma of baking pizza. Unfortunately, I'd just had lunch, but I am now determined to return in order to buy one of their slices of pizza. 

All of the descriptions for their baked goods were intriguing. Muffins studded with blueberries, crispy sourdough rolls, fat peanut butter cookies - this place is carb heaven. They've got all their breads in these tall shelves on the left when you walk in, and the place was buzzing even on a weekday afternoon. There was also something else buzzing... I was going to go for a strawberry scone until I saw a fly inside the cabinet, happily trapped inside with the scones. What a shame. 

It was a small fly, and none of the other cabinets looked sketchy, so I pretended I saw nothing and bought a carrot muffin and chipotle mushroom pastry. Haven't had the pastry yet, but that muffin made everything better. It wasn't too sweet, and there were walnuts distributed throughout the bread, making for a nutty surprise every couple bites.
author: Sophie W.

description:
Had a slice of the daily pizza, scone, mint cookie, and rosemary lemon shortbread cookie. The pizza was the best thing - good flavor, but the crust was a bit soggy.

The pastries were average - better than your grocery store bakery, but not especially remarkable. The scone and mint cookie were a notch above the shortbread (I couldn't really taste the rosemary in the shortbread, which was a disappointment).

That said, I can see why this place is popular - their prices are good, staff is friendly, and I like supporting coop businesses. When I went, it was pretty crowded - yet the cashiers worked through the line very quickly. I'm generally not the kind of person that goes to "breakfast" type bakery places, so I'd take my review with a grain of salt - think the average person would give it a solid 4 stars
author: Larissa M.

description:
What's that smell?

I mean that in a good way.

The smell of fresh baked pizza lured me in and sure enough there were two hot pizzas coming straight out of the oven.

I just had to have one.

Every day there's different toppings.

Today it was fancy mushrooms.

It was satisfying especially for a mid day snack.

This place is also a great place to grab homemade bread and support a local bakery. Definitely a win win!
author: Jack R.

description:
Dropped by today since my sweet tooth was calling, and I was not disappointed. The aroma of all the goodness that is carbs hits you as soon as you walk in, which makes it even that much harder to resist the temptation to purchase way more bread than one should consume. I ended up deciding on a strawberry cream cheese scone and wow, the strawberries on that scone were extremely fresh- still can't get over them! This would easily rank as one of the best scones I've had.

As for the ambiance here- it is extremely lovely. I felt welcome as soon as I walked in, and felt that way the whole time I was there. The only reason why I'm docking a star is due to their seating being extremely minimal, this is more of a grab and go type of place. If you don't mind sitting outside, there's a small area to do so which is surrounded by beautiful succulents. I would recommend coming here to relax while eating some amazing bread :) 

P.S. Arizmendi is super close to the 24th St. BART station, so drop on by if you're ever in the vicinity!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Arizmendi is the best. It is a must any time I am going to the City. Saturday mornings that start with their kalamata olive bread are the best Saturdays. I have been several times, and am yet to have something that is not delicious. Also, they are awesome about taking orders in advance as they tend to sell out of their inventory pretty quickly. My favorite bakery in the City.
author: Brett B.

description:
It's so nice having such a cheap and delicious bakery close by to home! I love stopping in here on the weekends with friends to split a pizza or grab some pastries.

The pizza is some of my favorite. The topping to crust ratio is just right. It's always incredibly fresh, with that just-from-the-oven heat. I don't think they change the flavor - every time I've gone it's been a mushroom, goat cheese, pesto combination. One time is was a sun-dried tomato pesto, while the other time is was basil-based. Whenever you order the pizza, they always give an extra half-slice, which is always a nice treat.

In terms of pastries, everything from just the plain bread to the sweet fruit snails are great. Everything is also really cheap, with a whole pizza coming in at around $20 and a half pizza around $10. I always split the half with a friend and it keeps me full for a whole afternoon. The pastries I've gotten range between $1-$3.

There's also a location in Inner Sunset for those who aren't in the Mission. I'm sure that both locations have the same excellent quality of product and service. This location in particular has a nice public parklet where you can sit outside and enjoy your baked goods.
author: Jenny D.

description:
Great bakery but wow do they play music loud. It's impossible to have a conversation. I don't think the people working here realize how incredibly loud the music is. Maybe they don't want people to sit for too long so this is s way to drive them out quickly. 
Great scones.
author: Guy S.

description: I love this place!! So fresh, delicious, and best of all reasonably priced. Instead of going to a bougie coffee shop and dropping much more than you would like to on a stale pastry and average coffee you could come here and get a freshly baked treat and coffee for ~$5-$6. Also this is probably one of the few places in the Mission where cold brew is under $4. The only tiniest of issue I have is that the straws they have are made of paper to be eco friendly (which is actually amazing could this place be any more perfect?) and they kinda melt.
author: Mitali A.

description:
Just try walking in here without eating something. Impossible!.

The baked goods, the pizza etc., all amazing. When something is this good, there's no need to spend a lot of time talking about it. The food speaks for  itself.
author: Jack L.

description: I'm torn because the pizza was a bit disappointing but the scones were bomb. I heart Cheeseboard and the like so I am hoping it was just a fluke pie that yielded our burnt pizza slices. It was still tasty...but we had to overcome some very dry and crunchy crust. In addition, the slices, both the full ones and beloved sliver, were smaller than I believe Cheeseboard serves. I'm happy I decided to grab a couple scones for breakfast the next two days because they saved my impression of Arizmendi. I had the wonderful corn cherry scone (I love cornmeal texture in general) and blueberry ginger scone. First of all, the corn cherry scone was huge, but it was also delicious with just the right amount of sweetness from the sugar coating on top. The ginger flavor in the blueberry ginger scone was noticeable but not overpowering, in case you are apprehensive about it. In both scones the fruit pieces were moist, which is of utmost importance when it comes to these things. They have erected a few rows of nice amphitheater style seating outside on the sidewalk, and there are a few seats inside if one wants to be sheltered from the wind. Parking was surprisingly easy--my friend and I both parked just a few blocks away on Valencia and easily walked to the bakery. Pizza may be hit or miss but definitely stop by to stock up on scones.
author: Amy G.

description: If you've been to Cheeseboard (or Sliver) before in Berkeley, Arizmendi is no different. Each day, a different vegetarian pizza is featured on the menu and pizza is offered by the slice (or in half pizza increments). Lines here can get pretty long during the lunch and dinner rush, but the line generally goes pretty quickly. If you're one to eat the crust on pizza slices, you might have an issue with Arizmendi. I found my jaws getting pretty tired after chewing the crusts of two pizzas. YMMV.
author: Austin W.

description:
Scones, good. Cookies, gooood. Bread, goooood. Pizza, gooooooood.  (read in joey tribbiani's voice)

The cowgirl cookie is our fave (and it's vegan!! So for it to beat a lot of regular non-vegan cookies is saying something).

Everything here is delicious. Arizmendis has become a weekly ritual to grab dessert after lunch.

Tried the pizza here for the first time last weekend and it was some version with artichoke, took it to Dolores with a bottle of wine, had a greatttt time. 

I learned that they're a part of the same coops that cheeseboard in berkeley is a part of, which makes sense but never knew til now! And assuming they're like cheeseboard in pizza quality, I'm confident they won't disappoint.
author: Nicole L.

description: I can't resist a good bakery, and this one is amazing! Love their pizza of the day which you can buy in whole, half, or slices and even par baked. Who knew sweet potato and goat cheese would work together on a pizza... but they've done it and it was delicious. I also recommend their shortbread!
author: Tina H.

description:
Sometimes it's the little things in life that can make all the difference. Whether you buy a slice or a whole pie, Arizmendi goes the extra [slice] and throws a little sliver of extra pizza with your order on top. 

Pizza was good, ambiance was good. Definitely coming back!
author: Isaac A.

description: Amazing must visit bakery in San Fran!  The daily pizza is amazingly flavorful.  I found the cookies and pastries exceptionally delicious!
author: Michael K.

description: This review is for the pizza here. I had a slice and sliver of their Early Girl Tomato, California Corn, Feta, Mozzarella, Guasacaca pizza and thought it was somewhat underwhelming. The pizza has similarities to what they have at Cheese Board in Berkeley, but it does not compare. First of all, the slices here are smaller than those at Cheese Board for the same price. I did like how fresh the ingredients were. The flavor of the tomatoes was intense and delicious. I wished they put more on the pizza! The avocado sauce slathered on top was also very tasty. Aside from the toppings, there was a lot of dough, barely any cheese, and too much crust. It was very dry and bland finishing off the pizza. It would be nice to have some sauce (like the papi chulo sauce at Cheese Board) available to dip the crust in.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Pizza of the Day for less than $3 a slice? In SF?! Unreal!!

Yes, absolutely real! Sure, one can make an argument for whatever pizza place in SF is best, but not many places can boast quality taste at an affordable price like Arizmendi can.

I've been here on several different occasions and have yet to encounter a pizza I didn't like! From toasted walnuts to pecorino romano to smoked mozzarella (on any given day), there is definitely an exotic take on the pizza we are used to, and yet they always ended up being so warm, well-made, and delicious!

I'm also a sucker for artichoke pastries in general, so I was glad to see that they had some in those drawers on your left as you walk into the bakery. It could be better if it was warmed up so that the bread can soften and attain a crunchier texture, but it was still satisfactory to my tastebuds.

It's also nice to support a worker owned bakery that promotes sustainable living and ongoing career development. Keep it up!
author: Viet N.

description:
They make one flavor pizza a day here - or so I am told. I'm not going to lie and tell u that I get my own special flavor bc I ask but I would suggest you try anyway. Don't let my experience stop u.  

Their breads are good. My favorite is a new one I have every time I go because I don't remember how good the last one was so I think "the one I'm having is the best possible one!!!!" (think voltaire's candide), but if I could remember I'd probably say the egg breakfast focaccia I had an hour ago. But next time - heads up bakers - what if the egg in the middle was runny??? Maybe??? Could be a #game changer for u guys?? 

I also had a pizza I attached a photo, went home and put more spicy on it and yes lord - it was a winner
author: Yoona C.

description: Omg! I still dream about the amazing pizza I had at Arizmendi. So thankful for my Airbnb host for recommending this gem. On a separate visit, I tried the chocolate chip cookie (yuuuuum) and the egg and cheese focaccia which was extremely filling and oh so good. My sister also loved her scone. Their prices are so low for such high quality goodies. Love the coop model. Wish I had an Arizmendi Bakery in NYC but until then...sigh. I'll have to get back to SF. Thank you Arizmendi, and kudos!
author: Y M.

description: Wonderful service and wonderful pizza.  I love/hate that you can only get the one flavor of the day pizza here.  But it is so quaint and friendly that I won't let it deter me from another visit.  Super yummy!
author: Gena L.

description: Delicious! I love Arizmendi because it's super affordable (in SF terms) and they have amazing pizza (very similar to Cheeseboard in Berkeley... same co-op?) for $2.75 a slice, which is really a slice + 1/4 of a slice. Their chocolate chip cookies are also great! They're huge and have chunks of chocolate and some sea salt as well for $2.00. Highly recommend coming by for a snack or a quick lunch!
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
$2.75 for a slice of fresh pizza. 

Tomatillos pesto peppers garlic oil

Yum yum

Walked here from24th Bart, via grocery outlet, and on to Italian homemade raviolis

Aug 19 2017

Early Girl Tomato, Sweet and Hot Peppers, Smoked Mozzarella, Garlic Olive Oil, Chive
author: Foodlover B.

description: Lots of delicious breads and pizza.  Reasonable prices, good food, and public seating just outside.
author: Merce M.

description:
Come here for the daily pizza (delicious when fresh out of the oven, no matter what the toppings are that day), the pastries (gluten free too!) and the bread (the sour dough is highly addicting). 

Service here can be sassy compared to the Arizmendi location in the Sunset. Sometimes the pizza is out for a few mins too long and the cheese is no longer melted. Be warned, if you ask for warmer slice, or for the slice to be re-heated, you'll get a sassy show of pizza tossing into the garbage and an earful of passive, with a pinch of condescending remarks. 

If you like cold pizza, you won't have an issue.
author: Janice K.

description:
Solid pastries, amazing pizza. The pastry selection isn't anything mind-blowing, with your standard muffins, scones, and breads. I came around 11am on a weekday and there was no essentially no line. The pastries were fine, but no longer had that "baked this morning" warmth or freshness. 

The pizza, on the other hand, was hot and delicious. They have a few different daily selections, and I had the Roma tomato. Delicious and cheap.

Would definitely recommend for the pizza, though I think there are better bakeries around for pastries e.g. Tartine.
author: Tim X.

description:
I stumbled upon this place while walking around aimlessly in the Mission, and glad I did! While skimming through the Yelp reviews, it looks like the pizza is pretty popular... so I decided to bring home a 1/2 pizza home to bake for dinner... and let me tell you, it was awkward walking around the area with a huge pizza box and riding it home on the BART. Two homeless men approached me asking for a slice... which then resulted in being called a "cheapskate" for not sharing. SIgh, oh, San Francisco. Despite all of the hassle of walking/BARTing the pizza home, it was worth it! I think it was worth the $11. It was super flavorful and not drenched in grease. The best part was that it's mushroom flavored, with spinach and pesto. Yum.

They offer a pizza of the day and you can check online what they're serving that day. I'll definitely be back and gladly pick up a pizza to take home again. Also, the people working there are friendly and patient. The lady at the cashier clearly explained the temperature to heat up the  pizza and the baking time.
author: Janet H.

description: Absolutely delicious pizza of the day, the pizza crust was so crunchy and crispy and thin, toppings were the perfect balance of flavors. Fast service. Grab one and eat outside on the parklet.
author: Long C.

description: Love this bakery, lots of Vegan options! Vegan  Foccasia yummy!!!! Scones, muffins, pizza! Come get it here! Its Delicious with a very friendly price!
author: Rhea M.

description:
A friend told me about this bakery a couple of hours before I stumbled upon it on my way down Valencia to a record store. It can be overwhelming with the amount of people confident in their orders, while you're their trying to decide which freshly baked pleasure to enjoy. The couple of glass cases were packed with warm, olfactory-pleasing scones, cookies, muffins, and other items that were more foreign to me. 

Luckily, the staff member was able to switch from focused and speedy to focused and attentive as he helped me decide what to choose. In the end, the cherry corn scone was a clear winner - especially after reading multiple raving reviews about it. And yes, everyone was accurate. It was a greatly baked scone with a crisp outer shell and slightly softer inside. The tartness of the cherries was perfectly offset by the sugary casing of the scone. The cornmeal, I guess, used to bake the scone provided a fabulous texture. 

Can't wait to try their pizza (unfortunately I just finished eating before finding this place) and other goods!
author: Jacob M.

description:
Stopped by here and got two slices of the pizza of the day. They were very tasty, but the only thing I wanted was more pizza sauce on it, it was mainly bread and cheese. The tomatoes on top were some of the tastiest tomatoes ever though. 

I would have got some baked goods but I just went to Anthony's cookies before this so I didn't want any. Next time I'll have to try the baked goods because they all looked really really good! I also saw someone get Mexican hot chocolate (which I'm obsessed with) so I for sure need to try that next time too!
author: Hayley D.

description: So much to love about Arizmendi. I sometimes pet sit nearby and always stop in for breakfast. The cheese roll, Rosemary/cheese roll and breakfast roll w an egg my go to. They have pizzas and scones and a great cafe w coffee. Eating with a cause is great- support small local businesses.
author: Amanda M.

description:
People. The pizza dough is your next date night in, group cooking meal, or just I-embarrassingly-ate-a whole-pizza-myself-for-no-reason - it's downright "hell of" good! (Sorry, those with gluten allergies)

Not sure how they make it but the sourdough flavor is both addicting and unique. The texture is crunchy on the outside but also chewy on the inside. One $3.50 ball of it will pretty easily make two medium sized pizzas - so it's also a terrific value! 

Bake it at 400 degrees until your toppings look done...I swear, better than most pizza out in the city. 

Annnnnd you're already at the collective I'd also recommend checking out the baguettes (competitive with the likes of Acme, Semifreddis, Boudin and SF's other sourdough institutions); the hummus, which has a real leg up on the processed stuff; and whatever delightful looking cheesy or sweet pastry strikes your fancy in the case. 

Their in house pizza is very good, but for whatever reason I've found always plays second fiddle to their sister restaurant Cheeseboard in Berkeley. 

Fair warning, they are closed on Tuesdays and on May Day!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
These guys can do no wrong in my eyes.

They're up way before dawn.
They bake organic.
They do wheat free.
They're not overpriced.
It's a co-op.
They're actually nice.

If you're looking for really girly cupcakes, this is not the spot.  But, if you're looking for excellent breads, rolls, cookies, muffins, or pizza, you've hit the jackpot.

Honestly, w their dedication to organic & quality ingredients, I'm always a little amazed when I leave w a bagful of goodies, & I wasn't charged an arm & a leg for them.

You get what you want from the bins, & they ring you up at the counter.  They have items that are available everyday, & some that they rotate.  Cowgirl cookies are everyday.  The zucchini muffins w chocolate they rotate.  I learned that the hard way.  But, regardless of the day you visit, it's all pretty fantastic.

Especially the pizza.
This pizza is outstanding.
Pizza flavor changes daily.  You can get just a slice, or a whole pie to take, & then bake, yourself at home.  
It is one of the cheapest slices in town.  Unbelievably so, considering the caliber of ingredients.  

A cheese roll here can be a sublime experience.  Crispy outside, rich & tender inside.  And I've already professed my mad love for their ricciarelli in my review of their 9th avenue location.  

If you love baked goods, Arizmendi is a must.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
My friend just took me here before I went to sit with my sister at the hospital,  
Our quotes are " the bakery has power over the people " chemistry at its best".
To be more descriptive. The line was out the door but moved quickly, you grab a bag and a wax tissue and start filling your bag, everything is labeled with its ingredients , there is also coffee for sale. Staff asks you what you have it's easy and friendly..  the chocolate chip cookie was loaded with chocolate,  my coffee cake was fresh and baked to perfection,  a few whole berries sprinkled in the topping were a delightful surprise. .there should be more bakeries like this all over the bay area.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
Who doesn't love fresh baked goodies and bread. I love their offerings they have. Just liek their sister stores same great offerings no complaints here.

Parking is tough!
author: Meishi M.

description:
Arizmendi is a weekend staple for me. The currant and fruit scones are amazing. The fresh baked baguettes are great and usually still warm!

If you're looking for a baked good or to host brunch, grabbing a few things here is perfect!

It's a co-op too! Support this local bakery!
author: Stephanie C.

description: This is a cute little feel good place.  Honestly the baked goods are average and the pizza is good but still not mind blowing.  Coffee is really good but totally depends on the barista.  Some of them know how to make it well just at the right temperature, some of them are horrible making it too hot and destroying the drink.  I wish I knew who I would get in advance so I could decide whether to get the drink or not.
author: V V.

description:
I've been living in the Bay for over two years now and I had not gone to Arizmendi (or its older cousin Cheeseboard). I know; quite a disgrace. Today, I went on yet another first date (please help me, I can't believe this is starting again) and my date proposed Arizmendi. 

He lives in the neighborhood and is a very fascinating guy. Men out there, let me give you a tip - no matter how feminist you think your date is, you should ALWAYS offer to pay, especially when it costs less than $10. Anyway, what did I get for $10?

Well, I got a Salvadoran Quesadilla, a slice of the pizza, and a medium mocha. I don't pretend to be a Salvadoran food expert by any means but when did a cornbread muffin turn into a Salvadoran quesadilla? It was tasty and had sesame seeds on top. The pizza was topped with pesto, goat cheese, and other stuff. It was inexpensive and good but I wouldn't go out of the way for it. And mocha, well, tasted like mocha.

Maybe I'm being too harsh. I liked everything just fine but I think I must have had unreasonable expectations due to its reputation. Arizmendi is very popular and we had to wait in line for a little while. There was no seating inside so we plopped down at the parklet outside in the only spot open, next to a crazy homeless lady with some sort of mental illness. It was a truly SF experience. As I tried to get to know him, I heard constant yelling behind me: "F this. Go away!" What a great way to start the day.
author: Yi Z.

description:
I love Arizmendi!!
But the thing is, I love this place more than the one in Irving.
Somehow I love their corn cherry scones better.
It's more moist and soft.
The texture is just perfect!
author: Candice L.

description:
Anytime I'm near Arizmendi, I have to stop in and see what baked delights are on sale! I love the fact that it is a worker-owned cooperative, and they offer a wonderful selection of cookies, pastries, and pizzas if you need to load up on carbs.  Some of my favorite items include their shortbread cookies (which are ginormous) and corn cherry scones, and I've always found the workers to be friendly and patient (even when it's busy!).  

While there's seating available, I tend to think of Arizmendi as a place to pick up your items and go.  If you haven't been, you should definitely check it out!
author: Keith H.

description: BEST scones EVER!! Super toasty on the outside (perfectly baked) and soft on the inside.  I was pleasantly surprise at how delicious the Gluten free scone was!
author: Rosa G.

description:
Sold on their scones.

I recently finished my review for Arizmendi's Inner Sunset location, in which I sang great praise of their scones.

I'm still singing that song.

My friend and I dropped by to pick up some pizza dough and, while we were at it, scooped up their scone of the day and a cookie too.

Their $3 apple blueberry scone was even more delicious than their strawberry scone because it draws on the flavor of two fruits rather than just one. And that firm buttermilk biscuit texture, browned and baked to a slight crunch, continues to make my heart sing.

While I'm a huge Arizmendi scone fangirl, my friend is a vegan chocolate mint cookie believer. For $2, you get a big ol' chocolate cookie imbued with hints of mint and peppered with big chunks of chocolate. It's as if a Girl Scout thin mint recently discovered fast food and gained a couple love handles...of chocolate. I liked it, but I liked the scone more.

As for our main goal, we picked up 3 bags of fresh pizza dough for $3.50 a pop. The bag didn't come with directions, and we didn't think to call and ask, so we looked up different pizza recipes online and decided to bake our pizzas at 400F for 25 minutes. The crust didn't turn golden brown as we had hoped, but the dough did bake all the way through. Works for me.

Scones scones scooooooones.
author: Adele F.

description:
Arizmendi is my go-to morning spot. I cannot get through the day without the iced coffee (Equator coffee) and a baked good. Arizmendi offers a few seasonal items, but their staples are timeless treats. When a holiday does come around, don't pass up the opportunity to try something new!

Favorites:
-Breakfast roll: Cheese on bread with different ingredients mixed in every day, such as pesto or jalapeno. Try the one with an egg!
-Chocolate thing: Basically a brioche with chocolate pieces. Yum!
-Lemon poppyseed muffin: Great snack for when you want something sweet but not too sweet. I love the muffin top because it's nice and crispy. I always eat that first. 
-Chocolate chip cookie: Expect thick pieces of chocolate chopped from a nice semi-sweet block. I reward myself with this cookie almost once a week. 
-Vegan mint chocolate cookie: This is one of the most chocolaty cookies ever. The mint extract gives a nice contrast to the rich chocolate flavor
-Pizza: You cannot go wrong with a slice of pizza from Arizmendi's. They have one pizza type a day. My favorites are the corn or potato days. I always get a slice with a small salad. 
-Pumpkin muffin: This one is seasonal, but I'm really really obsessed with the pumpkin muffin because of its texture, which is soft, but rich from the pumpkin

If you are not the adventurous type, I would avoid the lavender chocolate chip bread pudding. At first, it sounded like an interesting combo. I had one bite, and could not hold it down because it tasted like potpourri. Every bite was like eating a couple full of dried flowers. 

Overall, I highly recommend Arizmendi's. Do yourself a favor and buy a whole pizza. Take the pizza to Dolores Park to eat with your friends and enjoy the sunshine.
author: Joanna S.

description: I visited today for the first time with my sister and husband. We purchased cheese rolls and the three berry scone. They were amazingly delicious!! I would definitely go again.
author: Ashley K.

description:
Decently priced baked goods and pizza.

Not a fan of the self serve as you see people reach in with their filthy hand and try to reach the products in the far back while their sleeve rubs against the goods in the front.
author: Evan W.

description: This is probably my favorite bakery. I just LOOOOVE their pizza!!!! It is sooooo yummy! They also have terrific baked goods too and coffee. The main reason I keep coming back is for the pizza. Must try at least once. It can get very busy.
author: Jay M.

description: Fantastic pizza, gluten free scones.  If you're lucky get the unbaked pizzas left over from day before: super good deal.
author: Daniel C.

description: This place is great. It has a great selection of baked goods, it also has amazing pizza. This place is delicious, so I definitely recommend it.
author: TropicalNights ..

description:
When I was a little bitty freshman undergrad at UC Berkeley, I walked all the way down the giant hill from my dormitory above campus to go to Cheeseboard every weekend for pizza -- keep in mind, this was an hour roundtrip endeavor. 

If you've been to Cheeseboard, you'll love the pizza here. It's vegetarian (but doesn't feel like it is) with a thin sourdough crust. The toppings are always great, fresh, and creative. Corn and potato days are my favorite, followed by tomatoes and artichoke hearts. 

On the weekends, the best bread gets sold out in the mornings. On weekdays, I can stop by on the way back from work and still get some of best stuff... Which brings me to my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE: the X Roll (eXperimental cheese rolls). It's always some delicious fresh savory cheese roll with something like spinach, artichoke, basil, sun-dried tomato, zucchini, eggplant, corn, ... and the amazing list goes on. 

There's a fun community feel to this place. It's a cooperative, so the workers are the owners! Everyone has a firm stake in the establishment and you can really see it in their wonderful service and demeanor. 

Overall, this place is top notch as a bakery and a pizzeria, with wonderful service. The worst thing about Arizmendi is that it's closed on Tuesdays. Embed that day deep in your mind, because one day you're going to forget and be very very disappointed.
author: Christine L.

description:
Great spot for baked goods and pizza!  My favorites are the chocolate thing (brioche with chocolate of the type used in chocolate croissants), provolone and olive bread (so. good.), and pecan roll.  The cookies and muffins are good, but not as good as the items I mentioned above.  Coffee is pretty good as well.  

Lastly, the pizza!  They change the variety daily, and you can call ahead on the phone to check what the pizza of the day is before you visit if you're curious.  The pizza varieties are pretty much always delicious and sometimes are pretty inventive (once I got one with beets, goat cheese and arugula that was amazing, for example).  

A weekend lunch go-to for me is a slice of pizza, a baked treat and an iced coffee enjoyed outside in the parklet right out front (and there is a decent amount of seating inside as well)... it's a perfect combination!  The staff are generally nice but some are aloof.  They accept credit cards.  They have locations throughout SF and the Bay  as well.
author: Christine G.

description: Delicious baked goods and tasty pizza with pretty good coffee. Prices are average, though pizza left over from the day before are available at discounted prices.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Simple quality pastries with friendly service and you can feel good about supporting a local, worker owned coop. I picked up a focaccia, two pastries and a coffee for $10 which is amazing for this city. The bread is hearty, thick, and sometimes deliciously irresistible foil to my otherwise low carb diet. Grabbing a slice of pizza here is also a cheap lunch, served after 11:30 AM.

Breakfast Focaccia - Circular, thick, and filling. In the center there's a whole baked egg for your protein fix too. Perfectly chewy in the middle and crispy on the outside.
Chocolate Thing - Pretty hefty and dense, this could be a small meal. Bits of rich dark chocolate chunk are well incorporated.
Mexican Chocolate Muffin - Spicy as the name suggests, light and slightly sweet. 
Almond Ricciarelli - Off the hook good, lots of almondy flavor, chewy and sweet but not overpowering.

It can get crowded inside if you're looking to stop and eat. Some small tables line the right side of the bakery and communal tables towards the front of the shop. A public parklet is outside for seating as well.

With little lines and obscenely reasonable prices (perhaps dangerously so) skip Tartine when it's busy and come here instead. It's best in the morning otherwise good pastries will have sold out by noon. There's several vegan and flourless options too!
author: Truc N.

description:
Popular bakery for pastries and pizza. Consistently busy but never a long wait.

I've tried a few pastries from here and mostly found them to be just okay:

* LAVENDER SHORTBREAD ($2) - Disappointing in flavor. Not as much lavender flavor as I would've hoped, but as a shortbread cookie, it was good - buttery and not too crumbly

* BLUEBERRY SCONE ($3.25) - Their scones are incredibly moist! I've never really liked scones because they always tend to be on the dry side, but theirs resembled something closer to a moist muffin or dense biscuit but with a slight crispness/crunch on the outside. The scone was kind of bland though and sparse with fruit

* BRIOCHE KNOT ($2.75) - Soft bread sprinkled with raisins. I would've liked a fluffier brioche. Theirs was a little on the dense side

* CHOCOLATE THING BRIOCHE ($2.75) - Basically the same as the Brioche Knot, but with chocolate instead of raisins.
author: Jessie L.

description: The bomb  the cheese pizza here is super good. It's baked just right. Great customer service and super fast service.
author: Demario P.

description: Very cute place. I like the seating outside of the bakery too. I bought a baguette for $3 and it was good and fresh. Also tried the pizza of the day which consisted of broccolini, red onions, mozzarella, white cheddar, and lemon oil. This was the most vegetarian pizza I've ever eaten. Considering how it was only $2.75, I'd say it was alright, although I wouldn't want to buy it again. I didn't get much flavor from the slice. They give you a slice and a little tiny piece more. Not sure why they do that but hey, more pizza, not going to complain.
author: Annie H.

description:
Once in awhile when you NEED a sweet treat, this is the place! Absolutely in love with their shortbread.. The lavender one is just amazing! And for chocolate? Oh yeah, cowgirl cookie- or cowboy. Not sure which gender - oops 

they are simply the best !
author: Cest M.

description: You have to try the vegan chocolate mint cookie. It's life changing.
author: David M.

description:
I've gotten a bunch of stuff from here - crazy amounts of scones, croissant type breakfast things, cakes, muffins, cookies. Everything has been superb. Currently I am munching on their chocolate mint cookie and it's the best ever. I wish I bought more. 
Also, the spot is cool because it does a "serve yourself and tell us what you got in the bag" style business which is very much honor system and I like that we can trust each other here.
author: Veronica L.

description: Love the pizzas! It is an easy treat to take my daughter here for a little sweet treat or cheese stick or loaf of bread.
author: Benjamin T.

description:
Dear [Gluten-Free Friend], 

Here's how your gluten-free lifestyle has affected me. Ever since you've stopped eating gluten, you have lost your zest for life. Remember when we used to go to Arizmendi on weekends and during the week on our days off and gleefully filled bags with pastry and bread? We felt happy and satisfied all day. Even though our jeans were tight, our hearts were content. We would sandbag baked goods for the evening and the next day. And even the next day. 

Gone are the carefree days when you called me and we would both look at the pizza menu online while we discussed and put together a pizza eating schedule based on our respective tastes. Remember when you used to be able to order an entire Arizmendi pizza FOR DELIVERY from Order Ahead? We had the most wonderful time, eating that oh-so delicious pizza with super fresh ingredients and having plenty for 3 days of meals. The delivery option allowed us to completely avoid exercise, and we loved every minute of it. We would put on our pajama jeans or leggings bought in the Liz Lange section of Target and laugh at people walking by with yoga mats. Now, there is no more delivery from Order Ahead, and I am left to reserve entire Arizmendi pizzas for myself. I walk home by my lonesome and eat it in my apartment with the lights off, watching Lifetime, as a single tear slowly rolls down my cheek. I am left to wonder where did I go wrong? 

Because of your condition, I am forced to brave this impossibly busy Mission location by myself. I no longer have a second pair of eyes to ensure that I have purchased every delicious and fresh bread and pastry and to remind me to get a coffee. There's no one to tell me not to worry, that we will work it off tomorrow, although we both knew that we would not because we'd both be pregnant with food babies. 

Your gluten-free lifestyle has robbed you of years of bread and pastry eating. More importantly, it is really inconvenient for me. Your offer to go with me and get whatever gluten free item is on the menu is just sad and pathetic, as you are now but a ghost of your former self. Worse still, I cannot have, and indeed do not want, a bite of your bland, flavorless gluten-free food. I'm not mad, I'm disappointed. 

If you keep living this way and do not get the help you desperately knead (see what I did there?), I will be left with no choice but to cut you off completely.  I will not go with you to any Loving Hut restaurant anymore. I will not give you a bite of anything that you are going to want a bite of. I will set up a bread machine in your apartment and make sure that the smell of bread baking wafts through your apartment at day break. I can no longer sit back and silently watch you destroy yourself. 

You are straddling the line between eating bread, baked goods, pastry and pizza and being too far gone to help. Will you accept the help that is being offered to you today and meet me at Arizmendi so we can get your life back on track? The first step is the hardest. Denial ain't just a river in Egypt. 

Love, 
Santino
author: Sunny S.

description:
Arizmendi Bakery is a cooperative worker owned bakery w/ several other branches in San Francisco & in Oakland. They are affiliated w/ the famous Cheeseboard Collective in Berkeley. 
They have a daily rotation of artisanal breads that changes every day. 

See their website for current offerings:
http://www.arizmendibakery.com

They have many vegan options including:
vegan tomato & mushroom focaccia
vegan banana nut muffins
vegan scones
& vegan artisanal breads

All the vegan items are labeled vegan & are affordable. I enjoyed the vegan tomato & mushroom focaccia for $2.25 & will be back to try some of the other offerings.
author: Shane S.

description:
LOVE this place. Favorite Mission spot, for sure. A go-to anytime we're in the area in the morning, or taking visitors to the airport on their way out (become a bit of a tradition somehow). 

Have only had breakfast/pastries, no lunch or pizza. Very reasonably priced!

The pastries are to die for. Sweet, savory, cheesy, and all sorts of different options. You have to try the corn meal muffins. And the savory pastries with tomato, olives, mushrooms, etc.
author: Steffan P.

description:
Overall, I liked this bakery!

It's a cute little bakery in Mission District that is popular and busy, but that you don't have to wait a long time to get what you want (which you definitely have to do at Tartine, for example). They have a wide selection of baked goods, including several breads of the day. They also have a pizza of the day. Unfortunately I had just eaten lunch when I went, so I couldn't try their pizza. But I saw it, and it had a lot of fresh ingredients on it (mushroom, feta, zucchini, onion, parsley, and garlic oil on that particular day), and I fully intend to eat there for lunch next time I'm in Mission District! They also have the typical cafe drinks available.

My friend got one of the shortbread cookies. Every day they have several flavors, which they apparently rotate. She got the ginger shortbread. It had just the right amount on ginger flavor - decently strong without ending up chewing on huge chunks of ginger. The shortbread was soft and mild, not overly sweet. Well done!

I got the Wolverine (sourdough with walnuts, raisins, and apricots - which added a nice zing!), which I would recommend. The crust was perfectly crispy, yet it remained soft inside. 

Also, it smells AWESOME. Since they have a pretty wide selection, you can definitely stop it and grab a snack to fuel your exploration of SF. The main problem is deciding which one to choose!
author: Chelsea D.

description: I wanted to go to Cheeseboard today but it was closed on a Monday. My friend and I decided to come here instead because: 1. Opened on a Monday/ President's Day & 2. It's a co-op business with Cheeseboard. Everyday they have a "pizza of the day" where you can get it for $2.50 per slice. Today was Roasted Yukon Gold Potato, Red Onion, Mozzarella, and Chipotle Pesto pizza and it was tasty! I loved how they create their own flavor/style of pizza instead of remaking the mainstream flavors that every pizza restaurants  are doing. It had a unique taste and I enjoyed every bite! I think the pizza dough was made out of sourdough so it's definitely different from all the mainstream pizza places.
author: Ingrid H.

description:
IMy boyfriend and I were walking along Valencia when we randomly happened across this bakery. I was tempted by pretty much every baked good on offer, but ended up choosing a Mexican chocolate muffin. I love chocolate, and I especially love it for breakfast, so this was my dream muffin. For Mexican chocolate, it was only subtly spicy, mostly coming through when I hit the chocolate chips interspersed throughout. The best part of the muffin, as Jenna Maroney says, is the top, and that was indeed the case here. With its slightly overbaked crust, it tasted like the delicious edges of a brownie. It was a pretty decadent breakfast overall, and I was stuffed after one muffin. My boyfriend got the pecan roll, and the bite I had was both flaky and light. He loved it. 

The prices were fairly reasonable, with both my muffin and his pecan roll ending up between $2-3 each. The bakery itself has plenty of seating between indoor tables and outdoor benches, and it has a fun hipster atmosphere to it (it's a worker's co-op). If I had had more time in the city, I definitely would have been back to try their delicious-looking pizza. Next time, Arizmendi!
author: Katie H.

description:
Stumble across this place by accident and couldn't be happier. I'm convinced their pizza is laced with crack. My mouth is drooling as i write this review.
Oh... and their pastries... to die for....
author: Michelle G.

description: They always have a couple delicious vegan pastries on hand. Their bread is fantastic for the taste and price, Friendly customer service.
author: Kaylee P.

description: Arizmendi is the perfect example of a product oriented restaurant that works. There is one pizza made every day and only one. It's always vegetarian. They also have various baked goods. And there is minimal seating. So if you want veggie pizza or baked goods that is a reasonable price and extremely tasty, this is the spot. If you're not in the mood for that, then try another place.
author: Rishi S.

description: I just love their carott mufin.
author: Shinichi M.

description: Not sure how I haven't been to Arizmendi before today (I am a HUGE fan of cheeseboard in Berkeley) but I am very sure it will be a staple for me going forward. Delicious baked goods and even more delicious pizza. There's one flavor a day, and it's always veggie, but it is so good that it doesn't need meat at all. The crust is incredibly chewy and delicious. Starting to drool just thinking about it. The baked goods are also phenomenal. I tried both the blueberry corn muffin and the cowgirl cookie (couldn't believe it was wheat free). Enjoyed the muffin more, but will go back to try more things soon. Can't wait to try the chocolate chip cookies (they were out when I went today!) Lastly, the service is great. There was a bit of a line but it went quickly and the cashier was super friendly.
author: Sally C.

description:
I haven't been vibing on the pizzas of the day recently - they don't seem to have the compelling combinations that I'm used to seeing at Cheeseboard. 

I always like the cheese rolls and x bread (sense a theme...cheese and bread!) and also like the focaccia and the breakfast focaccia. I have tried a variety of different sweet breakfast treats (cinnamon roll, pecan roll), and they haven't been very good. They tend to be dry and generally lacking in flavor.
author: Wendy L.

description: Arizmendi offers great and affordable breads and pizza in a low frills. They always have a couple delicious vegan pastries on hand.
author: Aviana H.

description: I like the pizza and bakery. The only problem that I have with this place is cross contamination of ingredients that aren't supposed to be in the baked goods.
author: Jensen D.

description: I like the pizza and bakery. Some of the best pizza in the city, and the toppings change daily. The cookies are also very good.
author: Ireland N.

description: Decent bakery goods from this bakery! Allergen free items are abundant and delicious.
author: Divya P.

description: The pizza could be $2.50. I think that pricing would be more fair. I also believe they SHOULD notify their customers when they're using goat cheese. The focaccias are worth the purchase. It's incredibly filling and fresh.
author: Annie C.

description:
**This review is only for the pizza.**

If you love fresh pizza with fresh ingredients, this is the pizza for you. If you're familiar with Cheeseboard Pizza in Berkeley, Arizmendi is their sister co-op. They serve one kind of thin crust pizza a day, using whatever fresh vegetables are in season. For all you meat lovers out there, don't worry, the pizza is still amazingly awesome without meat.

**Note: Different locations have different pizzas of the day! **

This location had more tables than the location in the Sunset. You can get pizza starting at 11:30am. Like Cheeseboard, you get the extra free slices when you order a whole pizza. Since you're in SF, the crust is sourdough instead. That was a nice treat! On the day I went, their pizza of the day had mushrooms. 

This is a great place to go for a quick bite. If you're particular about your pizzas, just check their website and look up the pizza schedule for each location ahead of time.
author: Steph F.

description:
New is always better?!  I wasn't too big when I tried the original one in Sunset, but I went here with a group of friends a couple months back and picked up a slice of the special pizza of the day, an almond cookie, and a jalapeno cheese breadstick.

Loved my trip out to this one more, though I think the selection here is slightly less than the tinier original location.  The special pizza slice of the day was amazing!  Caramelized onion and brussel sprouts on a thin slice with a sourdough crust and just the right amount of delicious cheese!  The almond cookie was a chewy powdered cookie and had a very strong almond flavor.  The jalapeno cheese breadstick had the right amount of spice, but not too much cheese flavor.  I should have skipped this one.  

Definitely a great place for a cheap snack.
author: Cat C.

description: I am spoiled by the Oakland Arizemdni's at Lakeshore.  The space is nearly twice as big with just one more cabinet of selection.  The pizza here though is superb.  I haven't been disappointed with the topping selection.  However the service is a bit slow here.  I used to get the Mexican chocolate muffin.  But they changed the recipe on that.  It used to be very chocolatey with a chili kick.  But the last time I got this, it just tasted like cumin, with no kick.  I don't mind cumin itself, but it was odd, since it came out way too strong.  I felt like I was eating tacos through through this.  I was a bit disappointed.  But everything else I got is just as good as I remembered it!
author: Derek C.

description: Loved the bread! I am very particular with my bread and not every bakery/bread place makes the cut but Arizmendi is special.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
this place was all right. i've heard quite a bit about this place, and they have another location as well.  as i was at bodyrok for double spin on saturday, decided to stop by and load up on carbs afterwards. i got two slices of the pizza of the day - cheesy with rosemary oil brushed on top, and all vegetarian. $5.50 for the two and they even give you another tiny sliver - super generous.  i thought the crust was just okay - not from a wood burning oven though because it was really tough at the edges.  

baked goods look pretty good, but i didnt like any of their item choices, so strategically passed on the extra calories and opted for birite froyo :) it was pretty good pizza, meant to be eaten in the sun in the urban parklet outside the shop, but i wouldnt trek out of the way for it...
author: Christina L.

description:
This unseeming bakery in the Mission is a real hidden gem! The people working the counter are always really nice, and their food is amazing.

They have a vegetarian pizza of the day that's consistently high quality. I've been here a few times and I've never been disappointed. I also like their vegetarian focaccia, but the baked goods are only decent.
author: Yves L.

description: Arizmendi Bakery has my heart. I love this place so much and even though I try not to spend my money on food that isn't groceries, I find myself returning to this bakery several times a week and not feeling guilty because a) the prices are so reasonable and b) it's a worker-owned cooperative business. The pastries are fantastic, and of course, by now, you've read several reviews that rave about the pizza of the day. These are SO good. The pizza is always vegetarian, and each day brings something unexpected and delicious. The best part is that when you buy a slice, they always give you a tiny sliver to go along with the regular slice-- just enough to share with a friend (or save for yourself, which is really the correct choice)!
author: Wan Qi K.

description:
This Arizmendi is just like the others spots in the Sunset, Oakland, and the Cheeseboard in Berkeley.

They're usually efficient about getting the pizza out and they have a great selection of scones and other baked goods.

The pizzas are always vegetarian and sometimes the flavors seem a bit repetitive but for the price, it's still a bargain.
author: Art O.

description:
Not your ordinary pizza shop--they have only one type of pizza per day and you better get there early, since they run out! It's a little hit or miss for me, sometimes I just love the toppings they have for the day and other times, I would rather skip lunch. 

Pro tip, call them before heading over, they a have recording that will tell you about the day's pizza (the website is not updated correctly, so I would go with a call instead).

Other than pizza, their baked goods are delicious as well. I love their blueberry snails, it has just the right combination of blueberries, vanilla and dough. 

The seating is a little tight, wish they had space outside, but hey, it's SF!
author: Zorayr K.

description:
One of the classic Bay Area pizza places and bakeries. They have a rotating "special" each day for the pizza they make, and every couple of slices comes with a mini sample slice. 
Frankly it always tastes pretty similar to me - olive oil crust, cheese, and different vegetables. They had a chipotle pesto which was unique (never had t before). 
Bakery items are delicious and interesting, if a bit pricey. Cookies, chocolate things, cinnamon rolls, various breads, there's always something different (as well as the usual things they bake each day). They even vary location by location, so go to the other one in the East Bay. 
I haven't had their coffee, so no reviews of that.
author: Paul M.

description: Almost all the baked goods and pizza that I've  tried at all the Arizmendi locations are good or okay. Most. However unlike the other items,  I won't ever ever ever ever recommend the strawberry lemon scones to anyone. The scones are good, but this particular flavor on this day was fail. Unless you enjoy bitter chunks of lemon peel or rind. Usually people add the citrus zest, but do not chop up the actual lemon peel to include the white pith. Gawd, it's so gross. And it definitely wasn't just an accidental piece that found it's way into the batter. No, we are pretty sure it was evenly dispersed. Sadly, I was disappointed losing that $3. I should have just stuck with the chocolate thing - guaranteed happiness.
author: S. F.

description: I stopped by last year for a vegan pizza and scones and I still have dreams about their delicious food! I might make the 8 hour drive just for their scones
author: Lord V.

description: OMG, I have never been here before! Stopped by this place today on my way out of the city. I heard the pizza is different every day. That part made me kinda sad cuz I may never get to eat this awesome stuff again. Just amazing slices of pizza today...I'm guessing these guys know what they are doing! Give them a shot! You'll love it!
author: Sean M.

description: Lost of great baked goods. The pizza was excelent. A bit cramped because its so busy. If you are just here for good food and good customer service its a good option.
author: Big K.

description: I have worked at UCSF for 27 years and I had just discovered this gem of a bakery shop recently . Since I'm watching my carb intake , having a piece of their cheese and tomato bread is enough to satisfy me ( I believe in quality over quantity ). I will always look forward to having my carb with Arizmendi bread.
author: Estela J.

description: Love the food here. Pizza of the day is the best lunch deal in town! Such a good Vineland a good cause.
author: Todd D.

description:
I love getting myself a breakfast treat here on my way to work. My favorite is the chocolate thing. It's basically just a bun with chocolate chunks in it. 

They have really great breakfast pizzas too. It's luck but something you'll get them when they're still warm, fresh out of the oven! If I can tell they've been sitting out for the morning, I'll just pop it in my oven for a bit so it's nice and toasty.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Fantastic bread - best in town! Also try the breakfast focaccia. And last but not least, they sell delicious fresh pizza dough.
author: Andi K.

description:
Arizmendi Bakery, Panaderia y Pizzaria is a worker owned bakery that values social justice and local community. With a mindfulness for natural resources, Arizmendi's provide quality, affordable foods and creates a democratic, supportive work space. While providing workers with a sustainable living and ongoing skill development; we model and support alternative economies and cooperative ownership.

This bakery/pizza parlor is Oakland's one stop shop for savory and sweet. You can stop  here to enjoy a nice cup of coffee, a baked good or a pizza... or all three! I enjoy seeing my food prepared and you can literally see the bakers in the back whipping up treats and pizza pies.
author: Renia L.

description: Average bakery. Sometimes their baked goods are off, like Mexican chocolate muffin that is spicy and weird tasting. It left a bad after taste and I had to throw it away.  Don't get your hopes up from the other reviews.
author: Apple M.

description: Great bakery with good coffee. The pizza is really good, and it's always vegetarian. You can't go wrong with any of their baked goods, but I especially like the chocolate chip cookies (especially when they are warm and melty) and the cherry corn scones.
author: Ed M.

description: Absolutely amazing! I happened to stumble across this place.  I had a slice of pizza and some cookies for my kids.   This is a true San Francisco treasure.  Good prices.  I loved that the pizza is one type only - no being picky, you eat it or you don't.  I saw tons of locals come and go. Friendly atmosphere with a little outdoor seating.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Jessica H.

description:
In my quest to find the best cookie in the Mission, I stopped by Arizmendi since it is one of the more talked about bakeries in the area. I don't really see what all the hype is about.  To me it feels like this place can't make up its mind on whether it wants to be a bakery or a pizza shop, but in my opinion it does not fill either role well.

From the bakery side of things, I tried a few of their pastries and none of them impressed me. I took a few bites of their shortbread and didn't bother finishing it because it was so average. The cookie was slightly better but had way too much chocolate compared to dough.

From the pizza side, they don't give you any options at all. You basically have to roll the dice on their pizza of the day, which can have some pretty bizarre toppings on it. Lack of options is a guaranteed way to get on my bad side.  Kale? Potatoes? It would take no effort at all for them to have a few basic pizzas that everyone likes instead of forcing strange concoctions on all of their customers. Cheese, pepperoni, etc, this is not difficult people.

Also they have all of one table for everyone to eat their pizza at. Good luck with that.
author: Mark O.

description:
This spot is bomb. Its my go-to in the mission for the following: 

1. Amazing vegetarian pizza, daily. A new option every day on phenomenal amazing bread, made fresh. 

2. The best scones! I didn't even realize I LIKED  scones, as a food, till I had them here! I've been hooked every since. Their seasonal fruit scone is always good, but so are the vegan/wheat-free options.
author: Shilpa R.

description:
Been coming here for years (I'm surprised I never wrote a review) for either their savory and sweet baked goods. Our usual is breakfast focaccia, corn muffin, scone or their pizza of the day. I love that their pizza calendar is posted so I know what to expect. Sometimes if the husband and I plan on a lazy day, we would order a whole pizza (at only about $20 a pop) and we'll snack on it throughout the day. 

Prepare for a wait. There's usually a line but well worth the wait.
author: Esther A.

description:
Three words: Best eatery ever!

This bakery is absolutely positively amazing! Their daily fresh pizza is available starting at 11am and it combines a mix of fresh vegetables and organic produce. One slice is $3.00 which may be expensive, but is seriously worth the price!

While I usually order a slice of pizza, their other bread items are a must-try as well.
author: Junming G.

description: We LOVE Arizmendi! Every trip to San Francisco includes a stop here to see what vegan options of the day there are. They are friendly and everything they make is downright delicious!
author: Eve V.

description:
It's one of those Mission bakeries people talk about, and once you visit you understand why.
Note: Closed Tuesdays. Decided to walk over on 2 random days, both Tuesdays, and it wasn't open. Third time's the charm!

Their pizza of the day is very "Valencia"- the one I got had roasted corn, fennel, roma tomatoes , rosemary, and lemon vinaigrette. Yummy! I like how you get an extra 'baby slice' with your more standard slice. I shared it with a not-so-hungry friend, and she was glad to have tried it.

On the cookie front: the cowboy is great, chocolate chip pretty good, you can't go wrong. Almost on the level as Doughbies.
I also had the blueberry snail, which looks like a cinnamon roll, without all of the cinnamon, plus blueberries. Not too sweet which was a plus.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Unlike my experience of other Arizmendi's, they Do. Not. Care. about long lines during the mornings. I've been going here 5 years and all five of those years if there are ten people in line, and someone orders an espresso drink, those ten people have to wait, as the line gets longer, while the only cashier will stop ringing people up to make the espresso. 

Yes, every morning someone in line wonders why they don't cover the counter more. Obviously no one behind the counter wonders the same thing. I thought getting paid was the name of the game for arizmendi in the morning, but the name of the game is prepping for afternoon pizza .
author: Saul C.

description: Love their pizza! Always the perfect thickness, not so thick that you think you're eating a baguette and not so thin that it feels like a crepe
author: David G.

description:
Quaint spot on Valencia with a somewhat eclectic mix of coffees, pizza, and baked goods.
