I opted for a slice of their mozzarella, parsley, and onion slice of the day, which was delicious. The crust was baked perfectly and added just enough crunch. As for the toppings, there weren't an overwhelming amount, but plenty to add flavor and variety so that each bite was slightly varied in taste.

The space itself has a garage feel, with a long line forming outside and limited seating inside. Most folks opted to eat outside on the built in bench. 

I'd go back for their breakfast options: the scones and baked goods looked delicious, but I was in more of a savory mood. Fast and friendly service too!
author: Neal C.

description: I can't walk or drive by without getting something, especially the pizza and cookies. They give you a cute little sliver slice when you get a normal slice of pizza. The mint chocolate cookies are so good and vegan too! The almond ricciarelli is like a scoop of amazing marzipan.
author: Sloane F.

description: The croissants are delivered by angels from heaven, I'm sure of it.  There is nothing else to say.
author: Christin A.

description: We live opposite to the bakery,it's always happy to go there and hangout with friends with bites of there every day special pizza.At most special there similes welcome you to come every day.....
author: Yashwanth A.

description:
This pizza could be sooooo much better if
A. They used meat toppings 
B . They used meat toppings 
C. They used meat toppings 
D . Stop using vinaigrette on every pizza. That's not even a real topping. Wtf!??
author: Micah W.

description: Everything here is delicious. Daily pizza slices are always so unique and delicious. If delicious crust is your thing, this is your place. Dairy free banana muffin is another favorite!!
author: K A.

description:
Get the Pizza of the Day and a Cowgirl cookie! It'll come out to be less than $5 and you'll have had one of the most amazing meals in San Francisco ever. You can thank me later.

I seriously tried each and every one of their cookies and they're all amazing the Cowgirl Cookie is probably one of my FAVORITES in the world and it's consistent BOMB each and every time I get it, at both San Francisco locations. 

This Mission location is bigger than the Irving location. Although you can't go wrong with either locations, the Mission location one is probably slightly better tasting. *Gasp*

I love their concept of a bakery grocery store hybrid. When you walk in, most of their baked foods are in cabinets for you to grab of you want their specialty pizza, you can order that at the counter and they toast it up nice and hot for you. 

The service is speedy and friendly here. Portions are generous. Prices are amazing. Love this place!
author: Ellen W.

description:
This is my least favorite Arizmendis. The BEST one is on Lakeshore (in Oakland) - biggest selection, nicest staff. Here, the staffing is a bit haphazard and short staffed, the selection is kinda limited. 

I love their bread and they're walking distance to my house, I just wish they were more like the Lakeshore one, in terms of selection.
author: Dee K.

description: This bakery makes some of the most delicious pastries. The blueberry on saturdays is incredible.
author: Peyton M.

description:
Great delicious and fresh baked goods. The daily pizza offering is always delicious and is yet to disappoint.

We have come here on a few occasions, always trying a few new items out of their cases- and always pleasantly  surprised. I truly don't think you could get something less than amazing from here, however. The cheese rolls are always a delicious pick along with the focaccia. Their offerings vary with seasonal ingredients, which is much appreciated. 

The line always moves very quickly, and is the case at any other buzzing bakery, your selections will be limited the later you come. Prices are affordable for the quality of delicious goodies you get!
author: Lauren S.

description: OMG.. I seriously can't get enough of this place. Their pizzas are amazing! Their pastries are amazing! Everything about this place is amazing! You have to get everything here! Just thinking about this makes me so hungry right now. It's definitely not your typical pizza joint. It can get pretty busy and seating may be hard to find but that just means that this place is that awesome if it's that busy!
author: Nari L.

description:
4.5 Stars
 
- affordable
- high quality, unique, creative baked items
- love that it is a co-op

Subtracted 0.5 star for inconsistent quality in the lattes.
author: Lovina H.

description: This place is so good. It's a shame it's so far from me but it's worth driving into the city occasionally just to have some of their delicious baked goods and pizza. Their gluten-free Cowgirl cookie was a HUGE hit at home. The first ever new gluten-free baked good to have enthusiastic thumbs up. I will be making a trip for these again!
author: Karen G.

description: Great selection of pastries including a decent selection of gluten free baked goods. Will definitely come back for more!
author: Elena W.

description: I brought a few of my co-workers here for lunch. I've had Cheeseboard in Berkeley, and I knew Arizmendi Bakery was similar with their one type of vegetarian pizza a day. I haven't had this type of pizza in a long time, and it didn't disappoint. The toppings were feta, green tomato, and pesto. The green sauce was also smeared on the top of the pizza. Delicious! $22 split for a whole pizza between three people? Great. We also came around lunchtime, and the wait wasn't long. Their pastry selection also looked yummy. I'll try them next time.
author: Carolyn L.

description: I tried a slice of pizza.  It was hot, chewy and tasty.  Although the toppings were great, the dough stole the show. It was fresh and yeasty, falling somewhere between NY and hand-tossed thick crust.
author: Amy J.

description: I was in San Francisco for a visit with my Sister and she brought me here because she loves it. Had the blueberry snail it was so delicious! I came back before my flight and picked up some sour dough bread and some more sweet treats for my boys back home they loved it all!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Get the pizza of the day! Some days its  out of control delicious w extremely unusual yet delightful topping combinations such as loaded baked potato, that I can't stop raving about.

Other days its something rather typical and its very good but not exciting enough to rattle on about.

They always start with the basics ... A great sourdough crust and the cheeses are well above average and then add from there. While the epicness or lack thereof can vary greatly day to day, its hard to have a bad slice here-

 $2.50 a slice + sliver of extra
$10 for half pie 
$20 whole pie

Chocolate gf brownie round is OK -$4

Olive cheese bread is off the hook-$2-5 depending on size

Blueberry corn muffins and scones are awesome especially if you love corn meal $2-4

Can definitely get a fillup for 5 bucks. But it takes extreme self control to leave without a bag of extra goodies that caught your taste buds attention
author: Michael P.

description: I've lived nearby for years and only just now realized Arizmendi has a couple vegan pastries. THANK YOU FOR THIS GIFT! :D
author: Stacey J.

description:
During a visit to SF, one of my favorite spots every morning was hitting this little bakery. Love the unique selections and also digged how fresh most of their items were.

This place is located in the Mission District, which would seem out of place 10 years ago. It is still odd to me walking to places, it isn't the norm for me. But one exception to my laziness was walking to this spot. 

As trendy as the area is becoming, one thing I liked was how simple the bakery is. Yes they do have those health craze drinks.

There is some seating inside but can fill up quickly due to its popularity. You may even find yourself sharing a table with random strangers. Prices here are pretty reasonable. They have a wide selection of drinks and pastries, did I mention they also have pizza :) Perfect spot to start off the morning.
author: Enrique G.

description:
Arizmendi has fantastic food and is dangerously close to my apartment.  The cowgirl cookies are especially delicious. 

Tip #1:  Closed on Tuesdays.

Tip #2:  Some flourless goodies (not technically gluten free because it's in a flour environment). 

Tip #3:  Street parking on Valencia (the main street) can be difficult, but there's more parking--and free parking--a few streets over. 

Overall:  Try this place!!! Some of the best baked goods I've had.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Great selection of cookies and other baked stuff.

My favourite is the pizza. They always give a bit more than what you order and that makes such a huge difference. 

People who work here are also very nice. They give discounts if you wear a hamlet.
author: Sam B.

description:
What a great way to kick off National Pizza Month with some awesome pizza from Arizmendi Bakery.  This was my first time visiting and I had their 2 slices their Pizza of the Day which had mixed mushrooms, gorgonzola, and arugula.  Luckily for me that those were some of my favorite toppings on a pizza so it worked out just fine.  They taste just as good as they look (http://bit.ly/WgzVME).  I love how I they gave me the leftover scrap.  It was almost like a bonus slice!  They were muy delicioso!!!

They also have other baked goods that go well with their in-house coffee.  I'll probably come back again some day if I just want to chillax with a cup and a danish.  Or possibly for something sweet to contrast their savory pizza.

Overall, it's a great spot for a quick lunch or snack and just to hangout for a cup of coffee.  I'll be coming back again soon!
author: Rodney H.

description: This is the closest fucking thing we have to Cheeseboard in Berkeley.
author: Dora C.

description:
closed on tuesdays! 

get their slice of the day- morning, afternoon, evening, anytime is a good time for a slice of za~ 

I've never had a bad pizza or pastry here, and although the line can be long sometimes, it goes by pretty quickly.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Horrible customer service.  I am sad to say that I am no longer interested in doing business with, or referring friends to, this bakery. 

I ordered a pizza pie 3 hours ahead for Sunday night dinner.  Drove there to pick up and found out it had been sold off to someone else.  

-Counter staff:  "we don't have your pizza pie anymore.  I don't know what happened. We were in high demand, we must have sold it."    
-Me:  "Can you make another one for me now?  I can wait.  This is my family dinner."   (closes at 7:00pm)
-Counter staff:  "No we can't"

I talked to another man.  Instead of making it right (e.g. make me another pie), I got more excuses. 
-He:  "well, you know we're a co-op" (as if that was an acceptable excuse).
author: Zoon N.

description: Reminds me of cheeseboard in Berkeley. I can only speak to the pizza, which is delicious and made with sourdough. $22 for a whole pie, or $2.75/slice. No discount for purchasing more. They run out of pizza late. I swung by once around 6 and they were out.
author: May W.

description:
Can't believe I JUST learned that Cheese Board has a SISTER pizza joint right in my backyard!! While it wasn't nearly the same special vibe that Cheese Board has - what with its live music, long lines, and out of this world spicy green sauce, it was still pretty dang good and hit the spot. I personally didn't LOVE the gorgonzola, tomato, lemon oil pizza of the day and was quite sad that they didn't have any of Cheese Board's green sauce, but it was still great pizza. I also got a sourdough roll that was out of this world delicious.

Highly recommend for a cheap snack or meal. Only $2.75 for a slice!
author: Rachel L.

description:
They have very good scones, particularly the corn cherry one. The oat scone is also good. Buy more than one because they are that good.

The vanilla short bread is buttery goodness.  I tried the cardamom (too much spice for me) and the coffee-flavored shortbread but they are not as good. 

Try to avoid the cheese roll or focaccia, the taste is still good but they are so hard to bite on.

The brioche knot has just the right amount of sweetness.  

The pizza of the day is also good.  The crust thickness though is between thin crust pizza and focaccia bread.
author: Rhea F.

description:
One of the first places I visited when I moved to SF for the first time - I walked by the open double doors and after smelling the deliciousness couldn't stop myself from going in. The vibes in here are great - super nice staff, friendly service. The cinnamon rolls are incredible - delicious dough, tasty cinnamon, lightly frosted. Also strongly recommended are the "chocolate things" (chocolate brioche), as well as their chocolate chip cookies (huge)! 

The second attraction at Arizmendi: the pizza! Every day they have a different vegetarian pizza of the day. The crust is absolutely flawless and the inventive combinations of toppings are always fresh and healthy. Sometimes reading them off the board, they can sound kind of strange thrown together, but I've never been disappointed after peeking my head in to see the pizza of the day and grabbing a quick slice!

Definitely one of my favourite places to grab a quick bite on the way to work or a pizza to bring down to Dolores Park!
author: Victor S.

description:
All Arizmendis (and Cheeseboards for that matter) are more or less the same, so if you've been to one, you've been to them all. 

Not to say that's a bad thing. Pizza's fresh without being greasy, and the toppings are unique (potatoes, corn, etc.). The sourdough crust especially stands out.

Just two things:
- The line is always long
- The portions are somewhat small. Even the mini slice they throw in doesn't help.
author: Casey S.

description:
Love their daily pizza special.  We have not had one that we did not like, sometimes the toppings sound like they won't taste good together but they somehow meld together and taste great.  Employees are nice and friendly.

Be sure you read labels of pastries and breads before grabbing one, they have a variety of vegan, gluten free and regular items.  My family loves the bread sticks especially the jalapeno one.  If you're lucky enough to grab a seat (sitting is very limited), sit down and enjoy that slice of pizza and do some people watching, quite entertaining, a very diverse clientele.

Go for some pizza, bread, bread sticks.  Their pastries have a tendency to be heavy and doughy which is good if you like them that way, but if you're looking for light and fluffy go elsewhere.
author: J D.

description: Look, little animated Pixar girl: if Arizmendi puts broccoli on your pizza, get over your ridiculous preconceptions and just eat it. Because every slice of pizza from Arizmendi is goddamn delicious, no matter how strange the accoutrement atop the magnificently crafted pizza dough appears at first glance.
author: Tasha D.

description:
So I know this is a bakery, but I really came here to rave about the PIZZA.

The delicious and fresh pizza, that is. It reminds me of the Cheese Board in Berkeley because it is equally as good and cheap and they make one type of vegetarian pizza a day. I really ought to try the pastries next time, but the pizza just looked too darn good.

If you're in the area, make a stop by! It will be worth your while.
author: Connie H.

description:
They've got it all; wide sidewalk, roomy entry and counter, accessible tables.  The baked goods are self-serve.  While most are within wheelchair-height reach, staff are happy to get things for you.  

And totally worth it.  Great cookies, vegan muffins, wheat-free treats, good pizza by the slice.  Careful though - they sell out of favorite baked goods early on weekends.
author: SF Disability Awareness N.

description:
I absolutely love taking friends here on weekends.  We start with a walk in a park, then reward ourselves at this adorable little bakery. There is often a farmers market across the street and it's the most perfect place to walk around while you snack on a slice of pizza or a baked good. 

I come from Berkeley where  I'm used to eating the trendy "one type of pizza a day" pizza at Sliver and Cheeseboard.  I have to say that this place is up to par with the infamous Berkeley Pizzerias, I'm so happy I found it! 

The day we came they had mushroom pizza with goat cheese and cilantro and onions.  it was SO SO good! I could come here everyday if I could afford it in the belly...
author: Kristin C.

description: Pizza is delicious! I come here every time I'm in SF. I love that you can call in advance to hear what the pizza of the day is. My favorite is the one with the slices of potatoes (sounds strange but it's amazing)!
author: Karina V.

description:
Stopped by while walking through Mission District and was pleasantly surprised by their pizza! I've heard good things about their breads and pizzas and arizmendi didn't disappoint!

They have a daily vegetarian pizza, which they sell by the slice, half pizza, or whole pizza. I tried their pizza topped with roma tomato, red onion, feta & mozzarella cheese, and a mint-tamarind chutney which was super yummy. They gave it to us fresh and warm. I think their dough is what makes them unique; it's thicker than NY style crust but really light, less chewy, with a perfect crisp on the bottom. I liked the slight mint taste from the chutney, definitely complimented the other toppings. I'm sure whatever pizza they have that day will be good though!
author: Karissa Y.

description: This place is the best bakery in the Mission. Great pizza, baguette and cookies. My favorite way to spend a Saturday afternoon in the Mission is getting a slice of pizza and sitting on their park-let to people watch.
author: Martine P.

description:
Arizmendi Bakery is known for many things, but there's only one thing you need to know: get the pizza of the day! 

Their pizza is a thin, sourdough crust topped with whole milk mozz. Toppings change according to whatever is in season. Mushrooms, artichokes, feta, etc. No matter what -- it's guaranteed to be delicious and they gave you an extra sliver on the side too!

If you must get a pastry,  get the chocolate thing (really, that's what its called!) Or something with fruit in it. ANYTHING!

The only downside to this location? the long line of hipsters =P
author: Janice C.

description:
Skip the Chocolate Thing ($2.50)

It's a pretty tasteless, dense, roll (nothing like the texture of a brioche which usually is airy and buttery). Just pick it up, it feels like heavy and hard like a brick - when I took a bite, the texture and quality made me think it was stale, or maybe something from the Safeway Bakery section. The large dark chocolate chips were the saving grace, which is the only reason why I forced down 3 bites, slightly better when heated.

Pizza still is amazeballs. Everytime. Even when the ingredients don't speak to me I've thoroughly enjoyed it. And I also liked the shortbread with preserves. Gotta come back for the scones!
author: Jess C.

description: Updating my review because: what pizza place runs out of pizza at 6pm? Really regret the special trip we made out to the Mission.
author: Jane H.

description:
I've never met a donut I couldn't devour no matter how stale. It's nothing of which I hold any modicum of pride. It's just the way it is. But a scone somehow brings the persnickety out of me. I guess I've had too many dry ones to get excited over the prospect of another one, even if it is freshly baked. Even Samovar's are dry and need the one-two punch of the Devonshire cream and fruit jam to get it through my gullet. But Arizmendi makes the most amazingly moist scone for $2.50.

It was the Currant Scone (see photo), and a more satisfying scone would be hard to come by in this town. If you add the lure of a $2 Peanut Butter Cookie the size of a discus (see photo), then you should have all the baked goods you deserve for a week. Alas, Jamie W. and I shared those two items at nearby Dolores Park, and they were gone in ten minutes flat as a Heidi-tressed girl in gingham was selling her cookies. Seriously.

I was already familiar with Arizmendi from their longtime Lakeshore location in Oakland., so I was happy to see a new outpost near the 24th Street BART station. It's quite an inviting place, a cavernous space with wooden rack after wooden rack of freshly baked goodies from bread loaves to focaccia to pizza to brioche to all the sweeter items. Showing some restraint would be admirable under these circumstances. But now that I know I can find such tasty scones and cookies there, that will likely be impossible.

BAKED GOODS - 4 stars...really addicting stuff here starting with world-class scones
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...big place except there isn't anywhere to sit
SERVICE - 3 stars...they just ring you up once you grab what you want with the tongs
TOTAL - 4 stars...I will need to walk by quickly lest I epoxy the scones onto my butt
author: Ed U.

description:
Arizmendi is one of my favorite things about the Bay Area.

Their pizza is nothing short of perfection. Every time I pop in to get a slice I think "you f*cking geniuses..." because they do a great job with their ingredient selection. Not only that, their pizza crust is JUST RIGHT. 

There's very rarely seating available, so just get your pizza to go. At this location, you can pull into the gas station next door and run in without getting yourself in trouble. 

The chalk board in the kitchen currently only says "Black Lives Matter." This is the type of business you feel good supporting.

They use Ecuador Coffee and it's good ( no Four Barrel, yay!).
author: K M.

description: The vegan sweet treats here are amazing and delicious as are their non vegan options... Their drinks are on point. And their pizza... OMG... Their pizza!!! Wow to everything here!
author: David F.

description:
Their draw-in is their "Pizza of the day"..... Very very unique and very very tasty and VERY VERY VERY OILY. I had to pat down my pizza with 4-5 napkins. Ridiculous. It's not bad. Give a whirl... 

JY
author: Justin Y.

description:
Favorite bakery ever, SF and Emeryville locations. My go-to is the currant scone because it is just SO MOIST and SO TASTY and ughhhh carbs why are you so amazing. Have tried a good number of other pastries and have been happily satisfied each time. And if you've every tried baking scones and croissants and such, you know that it's easy to make it good but hard to make it amazing. So we've all got Arizmendi for that.

Thank goodness they don't have a south bay location...
author: Jenn W.

description: Their scones are so good! They're huge but really addicting. My favorite is the corn cherry scone. I also came here not knowing they had pizza. I had a slice of the mushroom and it was huge and a bit oily but pretty good.
author: Mona C.

description: This year, we ordered Thanksgiving desserts because we love the breads, scones and pizza here. Had the pumpkin pie and apple crisp. Both were awful; actually not edible. I make desserts every year and thought Id take a little break this year. Really bad idea. We are all super disappointed.
author: phil b.

description:
Arizmendi is right down the block and on the way to work. Whether you're going for bread, pastries, pizza or just a cup of coffee you're not going to be disappointed (unless you're coming a ridiculously long way. Don't do that.). 

You're not coming here to sit down and enjoy a meal - it's not like that. You'll stand in a pretty quick moving line, get your goods, and figure out where to eat it.

The daily pizza will surely be decorated with ingredients of the highest quality, but what is truly special about Arizmendi's pizza is the crust. They are a top notch bakery, my wife reminds me, so I shouldn't be surprised, but I still am. It's light and fluffy and just the right amount of crispy. 

A nice, big bike rack outside. If the weather is nice, it's always a downhill ride into the Mission, right?
author: Marcus C.

description: I love Arizmendi's. The pizza is delicious, as always. But I mostly love their variety of baked goods. I mean, if you're gonna fill up on carbs, might as well be the scones and muffins from Arizmendi's!
author: Sherry L.

description:
A must stop when in San Francisco! Great business model, friendly vibe & easy service.

Delicious muffins & scones. A daily pizza that I usually drool for..... Love the chocolate thingy, shortbread & vegan chocolate mint cookie. It's really tough (impossible?) to go wrong with this place!
author: Star S.

description:
I love going to Arizmendi for their vegetarian pizza. I do not have to think  about what to order and just get whatever is the special for the day and the pizza usually delivers.  The serving is generous as well and staff are very cordial. I was lucky to come on a Friday afternoon and there was no line! 

Very close to Bart station
author: Kitty D.

description:
The co-op thing brings back fond memories of my Berkeley days. 

When you walk in, the breads are all on the left in cases, and you help yourself.  All the breads are labeled with prices, and there's a mix of savory, sweet, and larger loaves.  

Starting at 11:30am, they have fresh pizza, and at $2.75 a slice and fresh out of the oven, it was really good. Today's was artichokes, spinach, and mushroom.  Similar to Cheese board in Berkeley, the flavor of the day is always vegetarian.  

Other goods:
- Vegan mint chocolate cookie: to be honest, I didn't notice it said vegan or mint until after I put it in my bag.  The chocolate chunks are good, but I'm just not a big mint chocolate fan.
- Galleta de almendra: covered with powdered sugar but an almond flour based cookie, kind of like a larger version of the Tara's almond cookies you can find at some stores in the bay area.  The texture was good. 
-Provolone olive bread: I got the small one ($1.75; the larger size is $4.75). To be honest, I chose it because it had crisped cheese oozing out of the side. The texture was soft inside, not particularly crusty outside.  The sesame seeds were a nice touch on top (reminded me a bit of a bagel)

There's not a ton of seating.  The line wasn't too bad when I went in the morning on a weekday.  Again, I think it's great that there's a co-op here, and the pizza was really good.
author: Marilyn T.

description: Well because I hadn't already overdone it on the sugar by going to Anthony's, I thought I'd round out the experience by heading over to Arizmendi for some pizza and shortbread.  Since, you know, that's normal and everything: gouge yourself on cookies, walk it off for a few blocks, and pick back up eating when you encounter fresh pizza and flaky shortbread cookies. Arizmendi's pizza was just what I needed to hit my sweet tooth reset button so that I could continue on perusing and eating my way through the Mission (literally).  In coming here around 1pm on a Friday, it was pleasant and enjoyable to sit at one of the tables and enjoy the hot food, followed by an immediate trip to their baked goods section where you can select whatever your little heart desires in paper bags.  The shortbread I had rivals some of the shortbread I had in London, except Arizmendi also has haute flavors that include lavender. I definitely would stop here for a quick bite and take in the cool open kitchen scene!
author: Lisa I.

description:
~Really great bakery and great atmosphere, right across the street from the 48 bus stop on Valencia near City College. I went with my friend on one of the few sunny days of Christmas break. I tried the blueberry snail for $3, and it looked way better then it tasted. It was heavy and dense, kind of salty and overly carby dough, not enough blueberries and the cheese tasted not right, like its been left out a little too long. Also, the coffee cups are small for my taste, I reccomend going to Philz up the block.

~Amazing score with the Ricciarelli cookie! Tastes like sweet, soft, and chewy almond pastethat melts in your mouth like cookie velvet, dusted with powdered sugar. It was a classy and flavorful cookie experience at $2.50 each, I took home 7 because it's a perfect coffee cookie in the morning. I lost with the blueberry snail, but scored with the Ricciarelli! Balance is restored to my day!~
author: Sarah C.

description: Went here for some breakfast pastries this morning.  2nd time to Arizmendi (Oakland) so I was down for the deal. The currant scones and fresh sourdough are wonderful. Coffee is tasty, but they lose a star by charging 50 cents for refills.  Highly recommended and we plan on returning for pizza tonight.
author: Paul V.

description:
Pizza del día -- so effin' good. I'm never disappointed by the vegetarian toppings, whatever it may be that day. So simple and so freakin' fresh! Like, burn-your-mouth fresh... But the thin crust is so beautifully crisp, I can't wait long enough to let it cool before devouring it. Yes, a little on the greasy side, like all good pizza.

The X-Roll is my new favorite take-home-for-later. I've raved about Acme Bread's cheese wheel for years, but the X-Roll may have kicked it out of first place with its delicious bits of chard.

Love the jalapeño cheddar stick, too! It's covered in pepitas and other yummy bits (I enjoyed it so much, I forgot to actually LOOK at what I was eating), and the jalapeños are actually spicy (yay!).
author: Pauline D.

description:
An excellent neighborhood spot. Not a place to come to if you're looking for a wide selection, but everything they do they do well at a very reasonable price.
Standouts for me include:
- Pizza: It's a rare weekend when their pizza doesn't constitute at least one meal for me.
- Scones: Particularly the corn cherry, but really they're all winners.
- Breakfast Focaccia: This coupled with a fruit scone has become my go-to hiking lunch. (Survives jostling in the backpack much better than a sandwich.)
- Cowgirl Cookie
- Seeded sourdough

The line can look a little intimidating sometimes, but don't sweat it; it moves fast.
author: Ben F.

description:
Nothing will stop me from being down for Arizmendi's pizza, including just having had Arizmendi's pizza. 

In toppings we trust, the crust's a must, I can rhyme, this pizza is always great wow.
author: Rachel R.

description:
TIP:
Go early as most of the stuff goes off the shelves very quickly.
Parking could be difficult.
All things in this bakery are vegetarian(Here vegetarian means it may contain egg.)

It's great for quick pickup preferably for breakfast or brunch. It's very affordable and tasty too. I got some Scones (Vegan Berry Scone) and Sheet Focaccia (Square Cheese) in my first visit. They have scones,donuts,artisan bread,pizza,cookie and much more.No place to be seated.Just grab and go. You could expect a queue.Would definitely go again and again to try new stuff here.

REVIEW 2:
I picked up some unique vegetarian(it may contain egg) baking stuff for my friends for a house-party.Enjoyed some square cheese sheet focaccia,fresh fruit scones,chocolate brioche and cheddar jalapeno stick.

It never ceases to amaze my taste buds.Great stuff.
author: Priyanka L.

description: I came here twice on Sundays when I saw on Yelp they close at 7pm and they closed before the closing hour on Yelp. They just put the sign on the door to close whenever they want to. Please remove the hours on Yelp so customers know to call before they waste time driving there
author: Dao E.

description:
ALWAYS get the pizza here. Always. At least one slice.

The fact that the pizza is vegetarian might not sound tempting, but it's actually really really good--it's creative and unlike pizza anywhere else. Plus, they keep making it non-stop from the oven, because the pizza gets sold quickly, so you know it's always FRESH.

The other main selling point of this place is the baked goods, e.g. muffins etc. Stop by if that's something you're interested in. Also, the inside is quite cozy, and I often see large groups and families sitting around enjoying coffee
author: Henry L.

description: Wowowowowowow! We stumbled upon this gem while walking through the mission. What a wonderful find! Delicious baked goods and such a variety! My favorite was the cornmeal chewy scone. I will definitely be back. Beautiful store!
author: Olive S.

description:
After shopping at Buffalo Exchange, I wanted a snack that I could take on-the-go, so I was pleasantly surprised that Arizmendi was nearby. 

I'm not even a vegan, but I love their vegan banana nut muffin! It's just so good. You have to try one! I also picked up one of their cowgirl cookie's and it was really tasty! I don't usually like dark chocolate, but the pieces of dark chocolate weren't too bitter for my liking. Just an all around good cookie that was pretty big. It was like an oatmeal raisin cookie, but 10 times better!

The muffin and the cookie were $2 each and I had a VitaCoco to drink. So, I spent $6, which wasn't bad at all. I'm definitely coming back to try more of their baked goods and their pizza! Oh yeah, I had a sample of their shortbread and it was good too!
author: Fallon P.

description:
I was in San Fran for a conference. This was the first spot my friends took me to after I landed. The pizza was so good! 

I am in love with this place. There can be a line but it moves fast and its a sign that there are fresh baked goodies inside! Get some! Now!
author: Omowale O.

description:
Arizmendi lured me in off the street with its siren scent - after I had just polished off a croque Madame and French toast Blue Fig breakfast I'd split with a friend.

Thought I'd just pick up a snack for the afternoon drive home and bought a ricciarelli (Italian cookie made with almond paste, sugar, egg whites and honey) and fresh fruit scone (pear and candied orange peel). Both were phenomenal!

Can't wait to come back and try all the other baked goods.
author: Cin-Yee S.

description: This was my first introduction to a coop style bakery!  It scored on all the points.  Carb heavy, of course, but aren't all bakeries supposed to be?  I wish they wouldn't use potato for a pizza topping.  Otherwise a lovely place to get away with an under 10$ lunch!
author: Chitra J.

description: Another of the great bakeries in the Mission/Now Valley area. Great pecan rolls, scones and bread. Apparently very good varied pizzas but I've never had any.
author: Richard D.

description:
Top 3 Reasons why the Mission Hipsters are about to get BIGGER HIPS:

1)  Arizmendi's Fruit Scones

2)  Arizmendi's Pumpkin Muffins

3)  Arizmendi's Brioche Knots

Fat Pants are the new Skinny Jeans.

---------------------

Update 7/2012:

Pizza Craving
Arizmendi Convenience
Twenty Dollars
Whole Pizza

Homemade Tomato Sauce
Goat Cheese Chunks 
Slivered Basil Sprinkles
Charred Thin Crust

Next Time
Half Baked 
To Go
Three Stars

-----------------------

Update 12/2012:

Dear Arizmendi, 

Thanks for giving me options for picking up goodies for vegan and gluten allergic peeps.  

Your Vegan Mint Chocolate Chip Cookies made my colleague happy.

Your Pumpkin Tea Cake studded with lots of dried fruits and chewy, almond flavored Ricciarelli cookies were enjoyed by gluten lovers and gluten avoiders alike.

Thanks,
Amy C.
author: Amy C.

description: They have a large selection of breads and sweets with very reasonable prices. I bought a loaf of their cornmeal jalapeño cheese bread. SO GOOD!
author: mary c.

description: I walk by this place every day on my walk home, so I finally decided to check it out. The pizza of the day was delicious, and my slice was fresh, unlike some places where they just reheat room temperature slices. Had a great balance of flavours, and it was satisfyingly crunchy. Very reasonably priced, clean and bright environment, and friendly service. I only had the pizza, so I'll definitely be coming back to try some of their baked goodies soon!
author: Jesse H.

description: I wish this was as good as the Arizmendi on 9th in the inner sunset, but it is not. Specifically the challah is not as light and moist. The pizza is too bready. It is still my go-to spot for a slice in the area, I love all the veggie combos.
author: Anita E.

description:
The smell is amazing.
The assortment of pastries makes it hard to decide what form you want your bliss.
The staff is nice, generous and quick.
Every piece of food was buttery good.
Egg and cheese, blueberry Danish thing, the chocolate thing, all of them never stop melting in your mouth.
Go with friends to try everything.
author: Vince W.

description: Good bakery and great pizza!  I could live off the pizza here for the rest of my life!  There's only one type of pizza and it changes daily (always vegetarian I believe).  I'm not a vegetarian, but I love this pizza. This is a co-op so menus change which makes it interesting.  5 stars baby!
author: Gabe M.

description: For starters their pizzas are pre-made which is a great idea but when taken out the oven all the tomato sauce was complete dried out. When I bit into my slices they felt like 2 day old pizza, dry. Some how still tasty but that might have been the buzz kicking in. I'd like to try them out again but not with booze so I can truly critique the quality.
author: Amanda M.

description:
I have only been here once, but I have to come back. We stopped in for lunch, drawn in by the pizza of the day, which was dandelion greens, lemon oil, and pecorino romano. We managed to find a table and place our order. It was phenomenal. The crust was the perfect balance between crispy and chewy, the cheese well apportioned, yet not overdone. The greens were delicious. I think maybe they were salted or sauteed or otherwise made more delicious before being added to the pizza. 

Moreover, one pizza satisfied me AND Siggy for only $10. 

And they had King Cake. I can't wait to return.
author: Brittany B.

description:
Great neighborhood bakery/pizza shop. I love how they serve daily special pizza:)
Chocolate things is yummy! And Parmesan so do cheese muffin.
author: Maitai N.

description:
Another bookmarked place *finally* makes it off my list & this go-round it's Arizmendi Bakery

We'd had original plans to hit Noe Vally Bakery but after reading the daily pizza offering at Arizmendi, there was no contest & as we were walking there, we could smell that deliciousness all the way down the block

Pizza of the day = Mixed Mushroom & Asiago w/ Basil Pesto.  We got a whole pie - cause, who wouldn't w/ *that* combo?!

Interesting to see them place the pesto sauce on top of the pizza BEFORE finishing it off in the oven - the pizza had already been made but they added the sauce at the end, which prevented the crust from getting soggy - brilliant!  

It was slightly thick, w/ a nice chew yet still crispy.  This may be my new fav pizza!

Could have used a few more mushrooms but given the abundance of asiago, it was quickly forgiven.  

Also grabbed a couple of Cheese Scones for later & those babies were phenomenal.....buttery, salty, lots of herbs & TONS of cheese.  I'm drooling a bit just thinking about them

Now that the dam has been broken, I can't believe what we've been missing & will certainly have to make up for lost time concerning our Arizmendi intake.....wonder what today's pizza is?
author: Adrienne G.

description:
This location is MUCH better than their Lakeshore location in Oakland.

I had a horrible experience at the Arizmendi in Oakland, so I was hoping that the Arizmendi in my own city would have the decency to show some awesome customer service. Arizmendi on Valencia went above and beyond to provide that! I walked in at around 11am and found that the shop was very crowded with people trying to get their pastry fix. Though it was crowded, the wait wasn't that long and when you got to the counter, a nice pleasant man was there to converse with you and ask you how you're doing. Nice! I was able to pick up a cheese roll, vegan berry scone, mixed berry scone, and a chocolate chip cookie all under $11.

Cheese Roll - Hm, I'm not sure if I picked the wrong cheese roll, but this seemed like a bagel with cheese on it to me. I guess the cheese rolls that I'm used to are the ones that can be found at Porto's! Nonetheless, the cheese roll (bagel) was very good, but a bit tough when cold. Definitely toast it!

Vegan Berry Scone - This was so dense, moist, and oh so delicious! The fact that it was in the shape of a real human heart was kind of funny, too. Anyway, the vegan berry scone definitely filled me up and was very satisfying! 

Chocolate Chip Cookie - I don't think I've ever seen a bigger cookie than the ones at Arizmendi.. seriously! These chocolate chip cookies were so chewy and packed with tons of chocolate chips. So good, yet so bad!

I didn't get to try the mixed berry scone.. or whatever it was because I gave it to someone, but I'm pretty sure that was delicious as well. Mixing good customer service with excellent products definitely gets a 5 stars and Arizmendi on Valencia did just that. I highly recommend this location!
author: Joyce E.

description: I'm a big fan of the vegan focaccia, and the collectivist spirit. My bf loves the oat scone. Sometimes the vegan items get mixed up with the regular items, this has happened to me that's kinda frustrating for us with allergies. Great items for a morning or afternoon treat.
author: Coco J.

description: I went for the first time as well as my friend. I was confused with their menu. I know how to read but confused on how the bakery operates. The cashier was helpful but was still talking to the customer before and I was very slow placing my order. My friend and I had to wait for our food and they called our names but we did not hear them. Was quite noisy and the music was a little loud. Not a big fan with their pizza but do not mind trying their bakery selections next time instead.
author: C G.

description: The one true test of a pizza is when you 'wake up' at 2AM, senior dudes will know one reason why, and after taking care of business realize that you are hungry. Arizmendi satisfies. If wnen you finally arise from your slumbers your sweet early rising partner has left you a foccacia and a Martha's mocha, you are triply blessed.
author: Patrick M.

description: Just tried the wheat free berry scone and am blown away. Finally i've found the perfect scone, it was not too sweet. Pizza is still the best and the people that work there are wonderful. Ps. they had chocolate covered strawberries last time i went!
author: jean e.

description:
What is this place? 

This place that sells cookies and pastries, but not boring ones, ones with a twist, ones that make you buy a Salted Lavender Shortbread cookie before you walk down the street to have dinner. 

The assortment of baked goods is delightful and the atmosphere pleasant, with tables for chatting with your friends about how drunk you were last night at Bootie or how brunch at Plow was to die for. 

Whether you want fresh breads or a quick snack - I absolutely reccomend it!
author: Katie K.

description:
Moving is hard, but moving and finding out you're right around the corner from Arizmendi is good. Really good. 

In the morning the sun is on that side of the street, positively bathing the store and all the baked goods waiting for you on the rolling shelves. There's nowhere better for that morning fix. Worker owned, I appreciate all the care the bakers put into the buns and loaves. Scones remain my very favorite, followed closely by the cookies. Have you tried the riconnelas, redolent of almond??? The fresh rosemary bread on Wednesdays? The bread pudding? The daily pizza offering? I could go on and on. They keep the quality bar high, and run a tight shop. I love this place. And then there's the flourless chocolate cake....
author: Mark N.

description:
Hi Arizmend! Thank you for transporting me back to Berkeley for an afternoon, I love how similar you are Cheeseboard pizza (not surprising since you're associated) but I appreciate all the delicious bakery goodies you have which Cheeseboard doesn't stock. 

If you haven't tried either, Arizmendi (and Cheeseboard in Berkeley) sell fresh, thin crust, pizzas with different toppings daily and they are always vegetarian. I'm not always a fan of vegetarian pizzas but I've always found these to be delicious. 

Tips: 
- On Sundays they start selling fresh pizza pies at 11:30 am. Arrive at least slightly before if you want to grab a sure seat at the inside communal table. 

- $ saving option f you don't mind (or even prefer!) older pizzas - they sell full pies of pizza that have been half-baked from the day before at 1/2 price.
author: Audrey N.

description:
If you're a fan of Cheese Board and Arizmendi baked goods you'll love this Mission location too. And if it's the only place you know for these creations, it's a pretty awesome one - I'm not sure if it's WHEN I hit it - early on a Monday morning - but the items I picked up were super fresh, tasting much better than Arizmendi's 9th Ave location. 

It would be nice if there was more seating - the space is so lovely but no real room for lingering - a conscious decision on their part I guess but too bad for us customer types.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: Absolutely delicious! I had been here a few times and thought it was good but had kind of forgotten about it for a while when I moved further away. My coworker recently brought a box of pastries in for Friday treats and I was blown away by the oat scones and had to ask where he got them. I will definitely be making a special trip this weekend to have some more.
author: Ayo R.

description:
Oh mah goodness, nothing cured my cross-coast hangover like a slice of their pizza, which is made daily from local ingredients. Thin crust and perfect organic veggies with olive oil and cheese. Thanks for the welcome!

They also have yummy chewy cookies, pastries, baked goods, etc. in huge-normous cases along the left side of the place and seating along the right. 

Closed Tuesdays.
author: Claire F.

description:
PIZZA, PHENOMENAL. BAKED GOODS, PHENOMENAL. I take everyone that visits from around the country to this place for a taste of San Francisco good mood food, and they all LOVE it. 

Only one type of pizza a day but if the flavor hits, it hits as an all-time favorite!
author: Juan A.

description:
Fawk! 

I never viewed Arizmendi as an enemy...or as a temptress. I accompany BFF here all the time for his carby indulgence & nothing ever tickled my fancy. 

We were in line on Sunday. I had no intention of buying anything...then I started reading pastry labels & ingredients & this.one.damn.cookie. is supposedly made with a bit of almond. I crumble & throw one in a bag. 

Fawk!

This riccirelli (sp?) cookie is fawking bomb. Powdered sugar, crispy outside & moist, sweet almond-paste inside. It's like a marzipan but better. I ate the entire thing before we got home & it's not like it was a tiny morsel of cookie. 

Welcome to the birth of a new obsession. You'll find me at Arizmeni next Sunday and at the gym Monday through Saturday to make up for it.
author: Fancypants X.

description: The bread is excellent, the staff is friendly, and the prices are reasonable. What's not to like about this worker-owned bakery.
author: Damian E.

description:
Always love this little bakery shop.  

I tried the pizza, coffee cakes, scones and cookies and all we're very good.  

Came here again on a Saturday around 12:30pm and the place was quite busy.  Don't worry, the line moved pretty fast and the staffs were all friendly and efficient.  

I already had lunch so I just got the peach scone.  It was pretty good.  A lot of peaches........

I will get more next time when I am there again.
author: Liza T.

description:
I don't think everything is amazing there but it's consistently good and I don't mind walking a mile (there and back) early morning to buy their stuff!  

My favorites: 
- The English Muffins: they are soft and tasty + cheap
- The Chocolate Thing: love the texture of this brioche bread. Could eat it everyday.
author: Melanie P.

description: Arizmendi is always good about having several well labeled vegan options. Among my favorites include the chocolate mint cookie, bialy, lemon poppyseed muffin and their seasonal chocolate cherry rolls/bread. Only wish they made a vegan pizza variety :/.
author: Josh B.

description:
Oh what glorious things one can find when one decides to take the long, scenic route to a routine destination! 

The path I took from Point A to Point B was not the shortest or most direct.  However, it was such a beautiful day that I thought it would be nice to take a drive down Valencia and there it was ...... Arizmendi!  How did I not know they had opened a location in the Mission (remind self to stop working so much and enjoy life in the City!)?  I returned with haste after running my errand to pick up some lunch at one of my favorite bakeries in the city.  Parking was really not an issue on a weekday as I found several spots nearby.  Seeing people with foil wrapped triangles walking down the street told me that pizza was indeed a big seller here.

I ordered a slice of their pizza that day, a combo of tomatoes, kale, onions, mozz cheese and garlic oil. Delicious!  Hot and fresh too.  Of course, I also picked up one of my favorites, the corn cherry scone.  

This space is 2x to 3x the size of the location in the Sunset.  There's more space for tables, chairs and display cabinets for the scones, bread, cookies, etc.  The only thing I didn't see was the bag of assorted cookies they have at the other location.  Maybe it wasn't the right day?  I like how they have made an effort to fit in with the vibe of the community at this location.

Excellent baked goods, and now with two locations in the City.
author: Melissa L.

description: I was looking for walnut bread which is made on Wed, everyday different breds are made. I tried their spicy chocolate shortbread cookie which is hot ! Coconut shortbread is ok, all their shortbread cookies are large and fairly thin and brad easily, I just wish they were little more buttery. Cheese roll is incredible and the cheese jalapeño stick is ridiculous - soft, chewy and not too salty ! Coffee is good as well....btw...the will be a line. No AE card.
author: Magda G.

description: Kind of overrated.  Can't get any of the pastries or bread warmed up.  Why do people rate this place so highly? Is it the pizza? That's not that special either
author: Samir K.

description:
BOMB. COM!!!!

If you love pizza this is the place.  I would say it compares to cheeseboard in Berkeley.

I would choose Arizmendi over Cheeseboard

The pizza crust is what wins me over.  It's the perfect combination of crunchy and soft.
author: Michelle T.

description: Oh the corn-cherry scone.... One of the best scones I've had in my life. Also tried one of the focaccia breads which was average. And their granola's are a must for home made yogurt parfaits. The interior is not as hipster for San Francisco standards, but yes, I am a fan.
author: Tina B.

description:
Amazing Bakery in a couple of blocks from my place and is the perfect location for any pastry/break/pizza fix.

I really like their breadstick (soo salty and crunchy, yet yummy!), their pizza (they rotate them every day) and their scones.  Everything is very affordable and even though the place is pretty small and usually packed you won't have too much trouble to access the items you want to buy. The place don't take AMEX but it's SF so this should not be a big deal. Also they don't take credit card below $5.
author: Cedric L.

description: Yummmerssss for sure!! I'm such a fan of their pizza and bread pudding that it is a danger I live sooo close! They feature different vegetarian toppings everyday--with the exception of Tuesday as they are closed... Also as a plus, they usually give you a tiny extra piece on top of your order, which goes along way as to the overall value! With regards to the bread pudding, my favorite is their chocolate raspberry heavenly mix! Each day is different again BUT if you get lucky, give that a try!
author: Daniela U.

description: Although the sweet roll I got was pretty good, not one smiling face in the place! The folks that work here seem sad. They don't talk to each other or smile. Like ever. Maybe that makes the patrons less personable too? Like a sad cloud over this place. Maybe too early on a saturday? Maybe just a fluke?
author: tiffany m.

description:
Really wanted to like this place more with a nice, casual vibe; an assortment of goodies in well-organized cabinets of three; and a mention in the SF Chronicle.  

I will admit that their apple scone was quite the something-something I was looking for that day, and their coffee is above average.  But when I asked if they carried any fake sugar (eg, Splenda) -- you know, the stuff pre-diabetics and diabetics alike need to use, especially when they set foot in a bakery.  Well, let's just say I got the cold stare like I was asking the wrong question, and this was followed by an unusually long, irritated-like pause.  When the answer was finally recited (I'm pretty certain I'm not the only person asking the wrong question), it came out as an indifferent, unapologetic, and booming-like 'No.'

OK then.  I'm sorry I asked.  I guess coffee with cream, sans the sweet stuff is going to have to do.  Talk about leaving a bitter taste in your mouth.  Next time, I'm going to have to head in the general direction of Philz Coffee on 24th + Folsom or La Boulange in Noe Valley.

I spotted the exit door and on my merry way I went.
author: Roger R.

description:
Tasty pastries and TONS of options! 

Come in, grab bags and stuff them with delicious treats. One of my favorites was the cheese roll. SO YUMMY! They're super friendly and I didn't feel rushed since I was bringing treats over for a breakfast get together.
author: Faye F.

description: AMAZING. Same idea as Cheeseboard in Berkeley, but I liked this one better. I loved the atmosphere/location-it's very quaint and casual without a huge crowd. You know that the main focus of this place is AMAZING vegetarian pizza. Perfect crust, perfect amount of cheese--I NEED to come back here again soon!!!!
author: Anila Y.

description: Super high quality fancy breads and pastries. I think they're employee owned.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Yum yum yum. dEVOUR the pizza. Today's was the artichoke spinach Parmesan pizza. $2.50 for a slice, $10 for half a pie and $20 for the whole thing. We started with one slice to share and realized how delish it was and went back for a halfer. I'm not vegetarian but this could make me. 

Scones galore to choose from too.
author: Cindy W.

description:
This place is great! But, what's wrong with them and goat cheese? They have pizza with goat cheese way too often compared to other coop pizza places. It seems like someone works here really favors goat cheese over non smelly cheese. Over 1/3 of their pizza calendar is covered with goat cheese.
Ugh... i want to go here today, but today's pizza is something with goat cheese. If you can't deal with goat cheese, check their schedule before you get disappointed.
author: Anna H.

description: Like the other Arizmendis it's quick, cheap, and delicious. Get the pizza of the day, and don't bother asking what's on it cause it'll be tasty and it's your only option anyways.
author: Misha T.

description: Bomb diggity! That is all I need to say. I got a slice of pizza and a coffee and it totally made my day. I will be happy to come here again and try all their yummy fresh baked breads they have!
author: Debbie R.

description:
Great experience. On our first morning of our visit to San Francisco we were just driving around the city and decided to find a place for breakfast. Arizmendi was close according to our GPS and er decided to give it a try. The staff was very friendly and service was quick. The food was some of the best baked goods we have had and the Pecan Rolls were hands down the best. 
Pricing was very reasonable and I would recommend a visit.
author: Mark S.

description:
My review covers only the vegan mint chocolate chip cookie, and what else I could gather from the ambiance. 

This is a worker owned type bakery, having various breads, desserts, and pizzas.  I got the vegan mint chocolate chip cookie as a snack.  It was decent.  Surprisingly thick.  Like an inch thick at the center, and thinning out to a centimeter on the edges.  The chocolate chips tasted great, and the mint flavor was good and not overwhelming.  I really wish the cookie was warm.  Perhaps there's a time of day when it comes out soft baked and perfect, but the cookie I received was cool and getting a bit hard.

UPDATE: Came here again and found an amazing vegan foccacia.  It was basically a focaccia with grilled tomatos, peppers, olives, and some other mushrooms.  It was amazing.  I will be coming here more often to try their other vegan baked goods.  I love coming here for the vegan mint chocolate cookies, they're always in stock.
author: Matt T.

description:
Pros: The pizza was pretty amazing. Thats all you really need to know.
Cons: Parking is tough to find and I can see it getting crowded at times.
Overall: Definitely stop by if your a fan of bakery goods or are looking for a delicious pizza to bite into.
author: Edward P.

description:
Mmmmmmm fresh delicious flavorful pizza.  They only make one flavor of pizza a day (like the Cheese Board place in Berkeley) so it's a gamble (especially if you think potatoes on pizza is weird).  But omg I eat a slice of pesto, goat cheese (normally I'd say eww), mushroom pizza and it was SO GOOD.  It's amazing how delicious that pizza was.  The latte was fairly toxic (so bitter, so terrible) but really cheap so this is still a 5-star joint as far as I'm concerned.  

Suuuuuch good pizza.  I'm planning on stalking their rotating menu.  So good. 

It's also really nice that it's a worker-owned cooperative and that you can see the baking happening in the open kitchen.  It's special to be able to eat stuff that didn't come from a factory and wrapped in plastic before it got to you.
author: Amy M.

description:
They make the most amazingly creative pizza every time I visit and for the price, it's a steal, especially if you get a whole pie. Their baked goods are divine...everything. I'm addicted to their seeded breadstick! 

And Equator coffee...woohoo!
author: HipsterChick S.

description:
DON'T COUNT YOUR CARBS- MAKE YOUR CARBS COUNT! :D

Pizza & Baked Goods: What a great combo.

I appreciate the changing menu for pizzas daily & that they make it fresh!
Quick & Friendly Service.

Mmm Mm Good.
author: Amy L.

description:
When I'm happy, I eat a lot. When I'm sad, I eat more. So basically - I'm fukd.  Arizmendi feeds my happiness, cures my sadness, and will always be there for me when I have to wear my fat Mervyn's (RIP) sweatpants. 

During this visit, we bought a cheese roll, a chocolate chip cookie, a sea salt & lavender shortbread cookie, a square of curry focaccia with mushrooms and sun dried tomatoes, and a slice of their pizza of the day: Purple Cherakee and Early Girl Tomatos, Sweet Corn, and Queso Fresco with Basil oil.

The sea salt and lavender cookie was muy lavendery, and you could literally see bits and pieces of the flower throughout the cookie. I thought, that's very potpourri of them. Nevertheless, the cookie was tasty. The sea salt did seem to overpower the overall taste though, in my opinion.

The cheese roll definitely has more cheese than bread. Their chocolate chip cookie is made w/dark chocolate chips, so although a tad bitter, the dough was sweet enough to offset it. The focaccia is always the perfect "take home and put it in your toaster oven" treat, and the pizza is "the best stuff on earth" per my friend. You got that, Snapple?

Seemed like we bought the whole store but only spent $11. Arizmendi keeps ur wallet fat and ur Mervyn's sweats alive.
author: Rho T.

description:
Pizza: Really good, interesting flavors. Only one type of pizza served each day. 

Cookies and English Muffins: So good. A toasted, sourdough English muffin with butter and a slice of cheddar cheese as a mini morning sandwich is all I need to get my day started :)

Everything else: Hit or miss. I've had some boring or dry scones and muffins.
author: J K.

description: Best bread since I arrive in USA. I try pizza, baguette, olives bread, onions bread. All were fresh bakered, crispy and delicious. They also offer free water and refill coffer. Love this place!
author: El Olor A C.

description:
Vacations are the perfect excuse to release your inner carb-monster, and while on one of my morning-runs-so-I-can-devour-carbs-and-feel-less-bad, I fatefully ran by Arizmendi, which had a small, but consistent line at 9 am on a Saturday morning.  The line was constantly growing so I suppose I'm lucky I showed up fairly early. 

Anyway, I tried the "chocolate thing" and the "wheat free mint chocolate cookie".  While many people rave about it, I thought the chocolate thing was just OK. It's basically bread with chocolate chips - noting really left to the imagination there. 

The mint chocolate cookie was great. Chocolate-y and very, very mint-y. Perfect to satisfy my Saturday 9am sweet tooth --- don't we all have those?  4 stars for the cookie. 

After quickly devouring the cookie, and stashing the rest of my chocolate thing in my jacket pocket, I continued on my run, and filed Arizmendi Bakery into the back of mind to come back when I'm in the area. They had a large enough selection, and supposedly some killer pizza, that interests me enough that I'll come back again.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Start your Saturday with some of the best vegan treats in town: vegan muffins are moist and never dense (by far better poppy seed vegan muffin than whole foods), the chocolate mint chip cookie is amazing, and for savory the onion bialy and olive rounds are usually available (when the focaccia is not) and always delicious! Top it off with fresh squeeze orange juice from the corner market across the street.
author: Melissa W.

description:
The food here is amazing - my top recommended bakery in the city. 

I came for the food, I stayed for the gorgeous muscular man with the cute gap in his teeth. 

Keep it up
author: Bob C.

description: Came here with my son, we loved the pizza of the day. We also bought  some baked goods, which were beyond yummy. I love the turbulence of people coming and going. I like being able to see the staff at work preparing our food. This place rocks and we'll be back!
author: David P.

description:
I like how Arizmendi is a worker-owned co-op, and I really wanted to like the bakery, but I found their items to be just so-so.

We had brunch at Foreign Cinema so we decided to wander around the Mission and look for some bakeries. Arizmendi popped up with some pretty solid reviews. 

My fellow yelpers recommended the chocolate thing and the cheese roll, so I got both. I didn't, however, get the pizza which seems to be their top seller. 

Cheese roll: I swear this was just an asiago bagel. The bread was chewy (not like a soft roll), with a hole in the middle that was filled with melted cheddar cheese. I could've picked this up at a bagel shop for $1. 

Chocolate thing: This was a slightly sweet bread with dark chocolate chunks. The bread itself was pretty standard although the chocolate chunks were good. 

Usually when I get home from a bakery, I can't stop stuffing my face. However, it took me a few days to finish these 2 items, which led me to give Arizmendi a 3-star A-OK.
author: Patti F.

description:
Besides their delicious pizza, their breads are also great. They only except cash, and that's the only thing I can think of a negative. But they still deserve 5***.

They are now taking cards:)
author: G. D.

description:
Tempting, tempting bakery co-op that I was familiar with in the East Bay. What a nice surprise that they've expanded to a few locations in SF, as well.

I sampled the pizza of the day (stellar, as always!). Vegetarian, fresh local ingredients, thin crust. Yum!

I also grabbed a blueberry corn muffin, sourdough loaf, and walnut sourdough roll to go.

Everything turned out fab! Reasonable prices, great products, and supporting local businesses beat purchasing packaged baked goods anyday.

P.S. Parking is tough in the area.

P.P.S. Credit card minimum is $5. Not a killer.

P.P.P.S. No seating. Grab-n-go policy.
author: Mansi A.

description:
Busy place! Marv, Max & I sharedn3 out of 4 gluten-free options: vanilla scone, carrot muffin, & ricciarelli. I preferred the scone while my sweet-toothed companions like the ricciarelli. 

Once in awhile I nibble on non-gf items for just a taste. Disappointed with the blueberry snail. Saw patrons snap up the egg-basil-mushroom-swiss-asiago foccacia; it's good!
author: Celeste P.

description: I've been a customer of Arizmendi Bakery since they opened their first shop in the Inner Sunset, and after my interaction today with a most pretentious individual over the phone, I will never go back.  And that is very sad for me because they do have, in my opinion, the best scone in San Francisco, among other tasty baked goods.  I called the Valencia store today at 7am, right when they opened, and requested a large order of pizzas for our staff party later this afternoon.  The guy said not a problem.  Then I requested that one of the pizzas be made without cheese.  His tone completely changed and he said "oh, we would not be able to modify our pizza", with an inflection in his tone as if I were asking for him to do the impossible.  Really?  I'm about to order 6 pizzas and you can't leave the cheese off one of them?  I had even been told before by someone at the Sunset location that they would be happy to honor requests for dietary restrictions if such a request were made prior to them prepping and light baking all pizzas for the day.  Apparently this level of customer service is not offered by the Valencia location.  I have worked in the hospitality industry for many years, and along with a great product, I feel warm and accommodating customer service is a key to success.  Now I doubt Arizmendi will be going out of business anytime soon, but today, they did lose at least one customer for life.
author: Eric C.

description:
Solid freshly made bread.

I much rather go to ACME in the Ferry Buidling but Arizmendi isn't a bad choice if you are in the area.

Overall Thoughts

They obviously are doing something right based off their Susent locaiton reviews, lets see what happens to the Valencia one
author: Eddie W.

description: Gorgeous space, self serve, staff owned and run. Enjoyed the most amazing chili chocolate (I think) shortbread today, it really wowed me. Wish I could take this place back home with me.
author: Bonny A.

description:
I don't understand how this bakery doesn't have a full overall 5-star rating.  

Uber friendly staff and ambiance is pretty chill space.  
Amazing pastries, breads, and pizza.  
Love this place!
author: Cat C.

description:
Truly delicious baked goods....the smells wafting out the door will tempt any tastebuds.  The muffins are very moist; the breads can use some butter when serving.  I absolutely love the bran muffins, which are uber hearty and have tons of raisins and chopped walnuts, and the corn-bluberry muffins, which are a delicate crumb without an overwhelming corn flavor (just enough for sweetness) and large, plump blueberries.  The english muffins have excellent flavor, but they can be a little on the dry side to eat...well...dry.  The fig-fennel bread is sweet and does not have a predominant fennel flavor, but it is very good toasted with butter.

I will definitely be back.  I need to try the pizza.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
The Breakfast foccasha was delicious..
 recommend this place for anyone trying to get a quick bite made fresh to order
author: Baltimore N.

description: Cheese rolls,  scones  freshly baked pastries and pizzas are all delicious.  I loved smelling the aromas when you walk in and the open concept kitchen.  The staff and service are quick and efficient.  I love the labor of love that goes into each baked item.
author: Erika A.

description: The pizza of the day had broccolini, onions, white cheddar - I had a slice and it was alright. It was thin crust so not very filling. Good for a quick lunch - they have self serve water on the side.
author: Anastasia A.

description:
I kinda hate when places are perfect. It lends to a boring review. 

Best bakery in the city. Pizza is great. Go there buy anything and you will not be disappointed. Snore.
author: H K.

description: I am such a fan!  Yummy carb goodness!  I love their daily pizzas everytime!  They change their ingredients daily according to what is fresh and in season.  It's usually vegetarian so you feel like it's healthy pizza with good cheese - mmm.  And I love their baked goods - their challah, chocolate chip cookies, buns, mm mmmm!  And their staff is so friendly and smiley, love it.
author: Maile N.

description: Stupendous cookies. The chocolate mint cookies - OMG, what chocolate is that? That is no ordinary cookie magic. Yes, that is what they should call them: Magic Chocolate Mint Cookies. And the Italian almond/egg white/powdered sugar cookies... starts with an "A" - forgot the name, but super amazing. Would get both again, and will, next time I'm local.
author: Carolyn F.

description:
Come here for the pizza. Fresh, local ingredients. Vegetarian. Crispy thin crust. Hot right out of the oven. AND you get an extra half slice for every one slice. 

Stay for a baguette, scones, cookies, cheese rolls, x-rolls, everything else...

There are only a few small tables inside, so plan to walk and eat.

Oh and I love supporting worker owned cooperatives.
author: Connie C.

description: I will seek out every opportunity to come here. Love that it's a local worker's coop, with a stated commitment to social justice and sustainable living. In line with their values, the quality of the ingredients and, consequently, products, is consistently high, and the combinations of these can be quite creative (for instance, the rotating pizza!). The prices are also usually slightly less than at other bakeries and pizza joints. In sum, I will never stop crushing on Arizmendi!
author: Shendi X.

description:
I wasn't even hungry, but when the smell of garlicky pizza wafted past my nose I just had to get me some!

Because the bakery is a cooperative that helps the community it means you're actually doing good while you scoff down delicious baked goods, so everyone wins!

Everything looked great and the wheat free chocolate truffle cake sounded pretty special. I had the slice of the day, which was a goats cheese, mozzarella and beet pizza. Once it comes out of the oven they run a brush laden with basil and garlic olive oil over the pizza  mmmmmm. I have never tried beetroot on a pizza, even though I live in Australia and it's pretty much our official national vegetable. The sweetness of the beets alongside the sharpness of the goats cheese was sensational. You couldn't beet it!
author: Laura D.

description: I'm in love with THIS Arizmendi's.  It's spacious, the people are nice and I now love getting their English Muffins (to die for and freeze great) and shortbread especially.    I love it when the coop "Gets It."   See you soon.
author: Stephanie N.

description: totally heart eyes emoji over this wonderful place... literally a slice of heaven (not just talking about pizza either. top picks for me are the english muffins, scones, challah, pizza... the list goes on keep up the good work!
author: Aaron T.

description: PLEASE ANSWER YOUR PHONE! What kind of business doesn't EVER answer their phone? Yes. You're website is down. That is all the more reason why you should answer the phone when customers are calling.
author: David H.

description:
I never knew I could crave vegetarian pizza on a daily basis. Or that there could be so many delicious combinations. Arizmendi knows how to make pizza right, and it's very affordable! I've even gone as far as to recreate their spicy chipotle pesto at home because it's some of the best pesto I've tasted--and I would have never though to add it to pizza! Nice touch. 

They also have great pastries in general. The cheese rolls are incredible and the foccaccia portions are hugeee. I would also suggest grabbing a cookie (also huge).

I come here about once a week for breakfast or pizza after work. There's usually a line but it goes pretty quickly. The staff is really friendly too!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
I stopped here in between apartment showings because it smelled SO GOOD. First, THANK YOU guy I saw shoving three cranberry-cornmeal scones down a paper bag because you have showed me the way to delicious pastry heaven. 

Unfortunately this review is only for the cranberry-cornmeal scone because I was dumb and only picked up one pastry while everyone else was lined up full bagfuls.... (There's a long table but nobody was sitting, of course - they don't call it rush hour for no reason.)

But damn isn't cranberry-cornmeal a good combination or what?? Perfectly flakey, a tiny bit crunchy, and all around delicious. I brought mine home and broke it up over some plain yogurt. Mmmmmmmmmmmmmm I will be back, Arizmendi. Even if I don't get that apartment in the Mission, I will be back.
author: Helen W.

description:
Do you like fresh baked goodies? Breads, pastries, muffins - yes? I was stoked to find my favorite East Bay Bakery is in my hood! Where have I been? It's been open for a few months now too. 

I love the freshly baked pizzas with interesting toppings like Chard. I love Chard - so I had to have a slice even though I am trying to stay away from pizza. It's healthy pizza. That makes it okay. You can buy the pizza dough here and they will explain how to use it. 

I bought some whole wheat sourdough bread and a slice. Reminded me of how much I missed this place.

The best thing I ever bought from Arizmendi was from the one in Emeryville. It was a fresh pumpkin cheesecake I ordered for Thanksgiving one year. It they offer it here, I would order that in a heart beat.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Anytime we are in the neighborhood, we stop by here for some pizza. We have enjoyed every combination we tried. The chocolate chip, peanut butter cookies, and scones are delicious. It's just a bummer if we go late in the afternoon because so many things are sold out.
author: Px C.

description:
My preferred anarcho-marxist-commune and bakery.  It's not clear to me what socio-political collective the workers organize into here, but they're staunchly for the people, for the worker, and you'll never find them open on May Day. 
Outside of their unclear views, they bake some mean bread. They excel at sour and savory loafs.  Sweets are not so great here - sugar's probably a tool of "the man" or something.
author: Ivan L.

description:
Cowgirl cookies are great! 

Awesome selection and great prices. Easy to find seating. Love this place for an afternoon snack.
author: Siobhan G.

description:
Great pizza! Scones and focaccia !
Worth the wait!
author: Alison W.

description:
Everything here tastes amazing, and the staff (it's a co-op) is great.  Reasonable prices, and they take bike coalition discount. 

My favorite things on their menu: 
* Daily special pizza; almost always a tomato-sauce free pizza with interesting / unique toppings.  
* Fresh baguettes; a tip: out of the oven at opening, 9:30 am, 4 pm daily. 
* Dark chocolate chip cookie; really buttery, really great dark chocolate.
* Ricciarelli; the almond pastry.  
* Walnut Sourdough loaves; treat for slicing and putting in the freezer.  

Bike parking out front, decent amount of seating inside.  They also sell "half-baked" pizzas that you finish off in your oven at home.
author: Zachary R.

description:
I only tried a few bites of the shortbreads and a chocolate pecan cookie and I haven't stopped thinking about this place since! 

The short breads I had were a great balance of dryness but soft that you look for in a fresh shortbread. I can say I was a fan of all the flavors but the molasses was yum. 

The chocolate chip pecan cookie on the other hand was one of the best I've ever had! If ya know me that is saying a LOT!!
author: Ryan P.

description: Fast, fresh, friendly, and delicious! I've been wanting to try this place since I found out it was the infamous Berkeley's Cheeseboard  sister. Very similar indeed. The pizza was scrumptious! I had one slice with a small arugula salad to pair. I love fresh veggies on my pizza. The only thing I'm missing is the green hot sauce that they have at Cheeseboard. Otherwise, this is a great place to drop by for a slice.
author: Marlene T.

description: absolutely amazing. best pizza i ever had and a very gret atmosphere. i will be back.
author: Snufkin M.

description:
The pizza is usually burnt for me and the toppings they add don't have that strong flavor that cheeseboard has. But if your craving a veggie pizza slice this is probably a decent choice.

The bakery has a good cheese bread though!
author: Rohan D.

description: Quick, delicious and wallet friendly pizza and baked goods. Very friendly staff from what I could gather as well. Maybe it helps morale that they work at a co-op! Just wish they were open Tuesdays! FYI- review is for SF location ( there is another in Oakland which I've not YET been too).
author: Jo K.

description:
HIt this place up a few times a week, either on the way to work or on the way home

THE GOOD:
Blueberry corn muffin
Coffee
Bread pudding (if it's sweet - Strawberry Chocolate or something like that)
Coconut shortbread
Pizza - no matter what kind it is
Prices - 

THE BAD:
Bran muffin - really hard and not enjoyable. Only food item I havent liked
Closed on Tuesdays - of course they need a day off, but seems like whenever I am REALLY craving something its a Tuesday and its so sad when i realize it
The wait - 1 out of every 3 or 4 times I see the line and decide to go somewhere else.  Its not crazy long, but sometimes can be frustratingly long (esp if someone orders an espresso drink)

Maybe I'm just an impatient asshole.
author: Brad B.

description: Arizmendi is an amazing bakery. It seems like it could be hippy nightmare nonsense, (where you're like, clearly you don't love baked goods, maybe you should get into making cardboard or focus entirely on veggie loaves, something more suited to your sensibilities) but Arizmendi manages to both use awesome ingredients, have wheat-free and flourless options, AND be delicious. Their scones.... god, their scones. This is my favorite bakery in SF, for sure.
author: Maria G.

description:
Mmm, SO good I could punch someone in the face!

I try to eat healthy enough, but that's all out the window when I come here.  So much carbs, so much butter, so much salty-sweet goodness!  Anything from a simple onion and poppy seed bialy to a warm slice of their daily pizza - everything is nommy noms!  I recommend grabbing something to go and head for a cup of coffee at Ritual down the street - a great combination!
author: Vicente G.

description:
I stopped in at Arizmendi just hours before boarding a flight home to Boston. I'd had such great sourdough all weekend long, but had to have one last fix. I'd walked by Arizmendi a few times and wanted to squeeze it into my last day. I walked in Monday morning, stood in line and ogled the breads inside the grab-and-go cases.
