This is probably the shortest review I will ever write because the ingredients speak for themselves. But if I must, Arizmendi's pizza had a light, crispy sourdough crust topped with small amounts of ricotta but heavily adorned with summer squash and sprinkled with lemon zest, parmesan, and parsley... Still thinking about it now... And it was two days ago!
author: Jane K.

description: The pastries are amazing! The coffee is great too!  Delicious vegan pastry options.  The line can be really long but it moves quickly.  The pizza slice of the day always has creative toppings.
author: Jessica L.

description: I first started coming here due to the tasty vegetarian pizza with imaginative ingredients (think: curry cauliflower, or jalapeno basil pesto potatoes). It's good and inexpensive. I love the bonus "taster" slice that they slip into your order. Buy it by the slice or by the whole pie. Post-work hours means a line starts to form (which is like a mating-call for the typical San Franciscan). Seating is at a minimum here, but the new window seats are helpful. Occasionally it's overtaken by the stroller-set -- so... you were warned.
author: Jen A.

description: Co-op workers of the world unite! So new the sign is still a spraypainted drop-cloth (or perhaps that's the aesthetic.)  Just the place for a rustic treat.  We shared a cheesy jalapeno roll (great crumb and chew), a cornmeal/polenta cherry scone (delightfully crisp), and the sticky roll, which was tasty but perhaps we should have warmed it up instead of gobbling from the bag.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Great spot to stop in and grab a snack or a casual lunch when doing the Valencia Street stroll.

The chipotle, squash focaccia was chewy, warm and full of flavor.  The artichoke and red bell pepper focaccia wasn't quite as flavorful but tasty nonetheless. The oat scone was good but definitely not a light snack, it weighed more then a snack should although scones aren't known for their lightness. They had pizza coming out and I will definitely be trying it on my next visit.
author: Kacey H.

description: A friend of mine told me a while back that he loved Arizmendi's pastries more than Tartine, and I was like, "Whachoo talkin' 'bout?" Despite the annoyingly epic lines at Tartine, their baked goods certainly back up that wait times. But, lately I've been realizing that Ariz does indeed have some amazing nibbles. What tipped the scale? A chocolate cake with salted caramel icing I devoured at a friend's birthday party. I don't even like cake, but I wanted to rub that all over my body while singing "Dreamweaver." Tartine who?
author: Christina S.

description: Best pizza in this city so far, and we're hard to please when it comes to pizza. The cinnamon bun was stick-to-my-teeth delicious.
author: Sharon C.

description: I've tried a few things here, but I don't really get it.  It's fresh, but pretty average in execution. The bread was way too hard, the cheasy bread sticks way too greasy, and the pizza not too impressive.  How can you be a bakery that fails on bread?
author: Artur R.

description: I went here yesterday afternoon with a friend of mine for the first time. As I broaden my horizons as far as finding places to get good food, I am always open to trying new things. I had gotten some pizza from here about a month or two ago while I was getting a tattoo, but yesterday was the first time in which I had set foot in there. The atmosphere was very welcoming and there a lot of good options in regards to baked goods. The pizza was amazing, and I'm glad that they only have one option a day like Cheeseboard, because I would have not been able to decide.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
good that they opened a location in the mission. carbs carbs carbs galore. I've had a hearty generously portioned choco chip cookie and also tried a piece of their pizza. Both were pretty yummy, although I wish the pizza had meat on it- just potatoes, which is carb on carb.

like I said, carbs galore. there are many more options to choose from: I saw rack after rack of scones, breads, muffins and different ingredients ranging from zucchini, pumpkin, and also the typical (blueberry, bran, etc). With decent prices I'd say arizmendi is a sweet deal.
author: Geralyn Y.

description: Each and every perfect slice of pizza that I have impulsively purchased (and then subsequently devoured) on an innocent Valencia St stroll has triggered my female happiness gene.
author: Christine R.

description: who would've known that a bakery could churn out AMAZING pizza as well?  i mean A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!  buy by the slice or if you're feeling beastly, buy the whole pie.  sharing is optional.  pastries aren't too shabby either.  my personal faves are the quesedilla (sweet and savory) and the corn cherry scone.  my taste buds do a little dance everytime i'm here.  o la la!
author: Melissa Y.

description:
Just what the neighbourhood needed--a bakery.
And doesn't it make you wonder why San Francisco has so few bakeries?

I am so glad to have a bakery like Arizmendi on San Francisco restaurant row.  The assortment is replenished fresh throughout the day.  I like the blueberry corn muffins--the most generous blueberry muffin I have ever enjoyed.  Often there are a lot of people waiting in line to pay for their baked goods or a slice of pizza but I have never had to wait too long.  Glad Arizmendi is part of the neighbourhood.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
How have we lived without Arizmendi for so long?  I don't want to find out, honestly.  Having never been to the Sunset location, I had no idea what I was getting into and the surprise was definitely worth it!

I clearly have a lot more to try... scones and pizza and breads, oh my.

In the meantime, I tried a great focaccia with mushrooms and spinach and we had breadsticks.  They were all amazing!

The yelpers are right, this isn't a great place to sit and stay - maybe they'll work that out.  What this is... is a GREAT place for an afternoon snack or a slice.

Welcome to the Mission, please stay a while!
author: Gretchen S.

description: Pecan roll, a perfect starting point and you don't need to know much else.
author: Jade W.

description: Everyone loves Arizmendi. Yes, they have some tasty baked goods. But, today really pissed me off. I bought a bread pudding and noticed that I was charged for the very small bag at check out. I bring my own bags when I go shopping, but not for a small pastry. I'm not going to put my pastry in an unclean bag. They charge the same for the tiny bag that Safeway charges for a big grocery bag. I raised objection and was told that they go through so many bags. Could it be that you're selling a lot of pastries? Stop ripping people off.
author: Bob B.

description:
[Amending my earlier lukewarm review, sadly to lower it further.]

Surprisingly disappointing lately.  Too many of the pastries are skimpy on the featured ingredients or otherwise bland and uninteresting.  A cherry scone I had recently held only a few cherries, and the 'chocolate thing' was basically a tasteless dinner roll with very few chunks of chocolate embedded in it. Despite the reputation, and my experiences with the offerings at the Arizmendi in the Inner Sunset, I've not had great experiences with this Valencia Street branch right near my home.

[Amended:] I am done with Arizmendi.  Since my earlier review I've now bought two more muffins that ended up having almost none of the headline fruit in them - today, a corn/blueberry muffin that had two little blueberries on top and a single lonely blueberry in the interior.  Not cool.  Afraid I'll have to go elsewhere for morning pastries. Really a shame...
author: tw s.

description:
I've tried this one and the one in the Sunset, but I'm just writing a review for this one because I'm lazy.  it also applies to the other one though.

Like their Cheeseboard style philosophy, but the pizza just isn't as good as Cheeseboard.  The crust always came out too hard both times, whereas Cheeseboard's is always the perfect texture.  If you like that type of crust, then you will probably like this pizza.  Not for me though...at least not for a third time.
author: AJ K.

description:
I recently moved to the mission and happen to pass by here on a stroll down Valencia. 

I had their pecan roll which tasted like heaven. The staff was nice and since it's a co-op it's nice to support local businesses. 

Try it out!!!
author: Scott B.

description:
Love their apple n cranberries scones and vegan cookies. their pizza is also to die for. 

Their price is another thing i like about that place!
author: Do L.

description: This place is wonderful. I can feel good about carb loading. The pizza of the day is the way to go (I wish it was a bit less greasy). You can feel good about buying from here. Great service too.
author: Mariam H.

description: Excellent pizza--just as good as at the other locations, if not better. Minus one star for their sometimes underwhelming pastries, and their mediocre granola and coffee. The fact that it's a worker-owned coop would make me want to come here regardless; their awesome pizza makes me happy to.
author: Mike B.

description: Simply... the best. Sure, you'll wait in line. Who cares? Worth it at the first bite.
author: coco c.

description: I have never had anything from here I didn't like.  Most of it I love.  When the vegan cookies are super delicious and I'm not vegan but crave them, then something is very right about the place!
author: Justin W.

description:
This bakery is AMAZING at what it does.
Delicious pizza, I've never had a slice that I didn't like.
Great bread, had a great buttermilk honey something that was really good.
My GF loves the scones, especially the ones made with fresh fruit.

And the coffee is delicious too!
author: Sally S.

description:
O....M....G. Sugar. Butter. Fat - the newest classifications of food groups. Arizmendi is all that AND a pizza of the day.

I sometimes pinch myself with all the riches of amazing bakeries (not bagels mind you) here in San Francisco.

I could go and on about all the wonderful scones and rolls and muffins and loaves of bread...but then I'd be here all day, getting hungrier and hungrier as I write.

Arizmendi is a DON'T MISS!
author: Mark M.

description: We had some cheesy bread thing that was quite good. I want to try out their daily pizza next time.
author: Captain B.

description: Love their scones.  Their chocolate thing is also quite a guilty pleasure - simply plain doughy and chocolatey goodness, not especially nuanced, but more for when you just want to overload on carbs.  They have a brioche but it's not what I consider a brioche (eggy, soft and bready?), although still good.  Hubby gets the savory, cheesy breads and I always end up stealing many bites as well.
author: Lisa S.

description: There was such an abundance of fresh treats for consumption here.  I snagged a Chocolate Thing and was not disappointed.  I was dragged in by the smell of baked goods.  I also appreciated the $2.50 price tag.  Very aptly priced.  I would have liked to have confirmed that their pizza is the same as Cheeseboard, but the timing obviously was not right.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Arizmendi's pizza was so damned good that I got in trouble with my girlfriend. I had it over at her house while they were rearranging furniture. My girlfriend's arm was hurt, so she couldn't help. Her roommate was lamely pushing a couch from one end by herself, trying to get it across the room. It kept going the wrong direction. I knew that I should help. But I couldn't stop eating. It was a basil and garlic slice, and I hadn't eaten all day. I just stood there in the doorway, watching my girlfriend's roommate try to move the couch, not helping, eating bite after bite after bite.
author: Charlie Bolognese Z.

description: Okay, Arizmendi has been a favorite of mine since I lived in Oakland, but when I had their pecan roll last week, I nearly flipped. Deee-lish!!! They've upgraded to whole pecans and the effect is nirvana. The pecan rolls are now a totally aesthetically pleasing, ambrosial delight. Gone are the pecan bits at the bottom of the bag. This new roll is a culinary masterpiece. Kudos, Arizmendi!
author: Edissa E.

description:
We live on 24th street, so we were delighted when we saw Arizmendi moving in on Valencia Street.  Although I don't always love the pizza combinations, there are other times when the flavors are just so unique and delicious.  I have recently become obsessed with the cinnamony and no too sweet brioche knot.  I tried to make it with the Cheeseboard Collective cook book recipe but it just wasn't the same.  Today, I tried the blueberry snail, which I think is based on the same recipe.  It has a touch of sweet cheese and some blueberries - a tasty treat!

Oh, and you should try the chocolate sea salt cake that they keep in the fridge.  It is super rich though so you should ask a friend to help you finish.  Yum!
author: Michelle Y.

description: Good bread selection, wish they had more classic breads, and reasonable prices. We stayed at an apartment nearby so this was our go-to joint. Pecan rolls are super yummy.
author: Fede O.

description: Everything here is pure crack. The brioche knots, the scones, the muffins, the pizza... everything. I'm addicted and it kinda sucks because there's no chance I'll be losing any weight anytime soon. You just can't go wrong here.. it's all so delicious. Just be forewarned, you may become addicted like me.
author: Aaron V.

description: Yum! I'm a vegetarian that lives less than a block away from this place, and my goodness do I love it! The baked goods are decent, but what I come here for is the pizza. I love the crust and that the daily toppings are always changing (and always veg friendly!). As if this all wasn't enough, I love that this is a worker owned cooperative. It brings supporting local business to another level, and I love that I can eat well at the same time.
author: Kathryn M.

description: I have a sickness for sweets and pastries and I was very happy to have walked past Arizmendi during work. I ordered the chocolate pastry and it was yummy. The server also gave us a free sample of their curry/feta/cauliflower pizza, which was delicious. I definitely want to come back and sample other goodies!
author: Rosanna T.

description:
3 words: CARROT WALNUT MUFFIN! enuf said.

ok - came back and thinking that the pizza slices score points too. that's enuf carbs for the week.
author: Ron W.

description:
I have never bought and eaten a single thing from Arizmendi that I did not love. In fact I have actually experienced sadness upon finishing some of their baked goods because I desperately wanted more (mind you, these are not small, unsatisfying, morsels; I just wanted to keep eating the deliciousness in an infinite loop). The prices are extremely fair given the quality of the ingredients and expertise of their bakers.

A couple of my favorites are the muffins (millet, pumpkin, and poppy seed), the cowgirl cookies, and the baguettes. My vegan friend says she loves their vegan scones. And though I haven't eaten their pizza in a while  I do remember that it definitely falls in the highly scientific, "yummers," category of food.
author: Sophia D.

description:
SO happy you opened in the Mission.  Please take advantage of the open space you have in the front and use 'em for outdoor dining and also where we can tie our dogs while we shop/eat inside.

Thanks
author: Marcia B.

description: love this place. first its supper chill. they have great bread too. but the pizza is always top notch. you wouldn't expect it, but it's bomb.
author: Farbod F.

description: Fabulous freshly baked options all day.
author: Vicki L.

description: Great pizza, good vegan cookie option.
author: Rohit G.

description:
Super-fresh, super-delicious, and worker-owned (yay). My favorites are:

-Pizza that rivals Little Star and Pizzeria Delfina for best in the Mission (sourdough crust and different toppings every day, check their website for the schedule)
-Cornmeal cherry scones (not overrated, best consumed w/ latte)
-Breads (second only to Tartine)
author: Adrienne S.

description: love, love, love pretty much everything here! The Granola, AKA Brown Sugar Crack, is stupendous. Hey, I just used the words "Crack" and "Stupendous" in a review :)
author: Mom G.

description:
This place is dangerous. Like, 2-blocks-from-my-apartment dangerous, and wallet-and-hips-on-alert dangerous. I stopped by today simply because its bright interior beckoned me inside from the rain that was pelting me on my walk home.

I'm mad for the vegan berry scone. Where many dairy-free pastries are dry and overly sugared, this little morsel is moist and absolutely delicious. I also picked up a single-serving focaccia round with five plump olives dotting its surface and a nice coat of delicious olive oil.The pizza looks awesome, and  if I could consume that cheesy goodness I'd try it out.

Efficient, satisfactory surface. Nothing exceptional--seems like a happy, busy cooperative. Let's be real: the baked goods and pizza are the stars of this place.
author: Sam S.

description:
I love this place - the vibe is great, the bread is great. We go here now instead of Tartine because we don't want to wait in a 30 minute line just to get bread. (though... I have to admit, Tartine is better IF you can fight the urge to smack the uppity hipster in front of you... I know I can't)

I love the rotating bread list.

Not to be missed:
Friday garlic asiago bread - beautiful whole cloves of perfectly roasted garlic. I think they must put at least a whole head of garlic in.Maybe 2. 
Cowgirl cookie
Corn-cherry scone (they recently dropped the cherries because of the shortage and everyone complained - THEY LISTENED and brought the cherries back - win!)
Earl Grey shortbread - Brilliant!!!
The pizzas are excellent. These are apizza style, not your typical crust, sauce, top. Perfectly balanced with toppings and flavor. Try the cilantro pesto pasilla chili if they have it.
author: Aaron N.

description: Everything I've had here is delish.  Especially the rosemary shortbread cookies.  If I am nearby I always stop by.
author: Jessica L.

description: Amazing selection  of baked goods  with a combination of unique flavors.  Daily pizza has never let me down.  This place is worth the calories :)
author: J G.

description: Just brought home a warm sourdough loaf and it was was MIND BLOWING.  Even my dad who is the ultimate bread snob said it was delicious enough to lure him across town.
author: Cork C.

description:
Ugh, so disappointed.

The food is probably 3 stars but the rude service at the cashier register bumps this down to 2 stars.

We tried their pizza slice and one of the pastries. We've certainly had a lot better. We prefer Arinell's for pizza in the same area.
author: j d.

description: What's cheaper, quicker and healthier than grabbing a burrito in the mission? A couple of slices at Arizmendi. This has become one of my go to place when I need something fast that's not fast food. Recommended.
author: Joshua S.

description: I have yet to find anything I like at this bakery, surprising given all of the great reviews.  The baked goods are dry, the pizza is greasy.  My attempts to diversify from Tartine have been foiled.  I've given up on Arizmendi.
author: marcie v.

description: I really only have had the pizza.  And, like all of the Arizmendi/Cheese Board family, it is very good.  I didn't think it was as consistent as the Cheese Board but the convenience of the Mission location and the friendliness of the staff more than made up for it.
author: S E.

description: Uh oh....Just discovered Arizmendi. Easy access for me via this location...Too easy. Very dangerous. Extremely high degree of deliciousness. Tried the fruit scone, a gingery shortbread, and a cinnamon roll. I have to say they were the best versions of these baked goodies that I have ever had.Now I'll be on a mission to try everything, including the very thin crust pizza. It looked uber yum.
author: Bleep S.

description:
damn good pizza
damn good cookies
damn good service
damn good everything, i guess
didnt hurt that i got my slice for free since it was their first anniversary!
good job recruiting new customers
will be back for more
author: beth m.

description: One of the best bakeries in the city, by far! I go here multiple times a week for a simple order: black coffee and a morning pastry. They have a new fresh fruit scone each day (apricot and walnut, blackberry pomegranate, to name a few!) and the prices are reasonable. Fresh baked with a cup of coffee (good, but not the best considering other options nearby in the Mission) is a wonderful way to start the day.
author: Katherine C.

description: I come here because I like to support local cooperatives, and because I've liked the Cheeseboard collective in Berkeley. This review is only for the pizza--it's near our house so sometimes we go pick up slices or a whole pie. I like that the pizza menu changes every day. However, the quality of the pizza (especially the crust) IMO is sub-par. All the times I've gotten their pizza it's been very oily, as if the pizza was almost pan fried. The crust is thin and doughy, if that's possible. And, the last time I got 2 slices for take out, the server packaged the slices together so that the toppings were facing the middle, creating an unfortunate "pizza sandwich." Why?
author: Timothy V.

description: Good stuff! Love the pizza and so cheap.  It's hand down the best pizza place on Valencia St.   I'm not even a vegetarian, would never order a pizza without meat, but their pizza is an exception.
author: Happi Y.

description: Life is good when you can swing by an Arizmendi's and pick up a fabulous pizza to go. Sooooo Delicious and the people are friendly too.
author: M.E. T.

description: Love their pizza..willing to drive 45 minutes (one way) to get a slice or three at 11:30am! I tried Arizmendi the first time in San Rafael, based on a local appointment in that area and my sister's recommendation. I remember a crispy hot crust, zucchini, leeks, garlic and lemon juice...enough to make me want more! Have been to the Valencia location twice, and even brought up pizza for a picky teenage son who doesn't really like pizza (which makes him an anomaly) but who definitely liked this one! Wish they had a Peninsula location, but am willing to drive (in non-commute traffic) for more pizza...oh and the pastry called the chocolate thing!
author: Lulubelle L.

description:
super yum & worth 5 stars-cheese rolls (but gut busting), daily changing veggie pizza, corn cheddar rolls, scones...

the berry scones always look better than they end up tasting.

skip the muffins- they have a dense and weirdly metallic taste.
author: s p.

description: I had high hopes for this place moving into the neighborhood because the one in the Sunset was such a nice treat, especially their cheese rolls, and because of their connection to the amazing Cheeseboard.  And maybe it wasn't possible to live up to those expectations, but for whatever reason, the Arizmendi in the Mission is okay, but it's not great.  The pizza dough is too hard and it's not made with the same attention and love with which the Cheeseboard pizza is made.  Also, the service is really lazy and slow.  I tried to like this place, but have avoided it due to their slow service, combined with their average pizza and the stale pastries, displayed in an unappetizing way, all making this place not worth the often frustrating hassle.
author: Nadine K.

description:
I'm torn between giving this place a 2.5 and a 3. Given that it is a bakery, which in my book means its part of the Land of Heavenly Carbs, I'll err on the side of generosity and give it a 3. If you've never been to the Arizmendi Bakery in the Sunset, then you're likely to judge this place as a 2. You get to be more generous if you start thinking of this place as Arizmendi Lite.

Why the discrepancy? If you've been to the Sunset store, then you start comparing this bakery's carbolicious treats to the original SF bakery (even though technically they're coops so they're separate from one another).  My fond memories for all the carb delights of the Sunset Branch color my opinion of this Mission branch's baked goods so that I automatically upgrade them a half a star to 3. 

I don't know if it's that this branch is still undergoing its growing pains having opened recently but the baked goods just don't taste as good as the Sunset store. In fact if I didn't have the Sunset store to help out, I'd rate this 2 stars. The cheese rolls don't taste as scrumptiously cheesy, the focaccia not as fluffy yet crispy,  and even the cookies are missing something because I don't experience the inner struggle against grabbing a large-sized cookie while waiting to pay at the register at the Sunset store. I have bought their Tahini cookie and am quite disappointed because it tastes burnt, not at all like the sesame its proclaimed to be made of. The X-Roll, which is essentially a Cheese Roll plus some x-factor like curry or corn actually manages to taste worse than the regular Cheese Roll because with the addition of another ingredient, the roll loses its cheese taste. I for one buy the Cheese Roll for the cheese. 

For now, I'll still patron the store but only when I'm on the hunt for a carb fix but not motivated to the point of driving across the city to the Sunset. Or, I'll come here on Mondays when the Sunset store is closed. Please improve fast so I can be "greener" and save on the gas to the Sunset.

Things to note
1. Focaccia is sold by the slice, not by the pound like in the Sunset.
2. Parking on the weekday mornings and early afternoons are easy. Parking in the evening (beginning at around 5:30 pm) gets to be tricky. Expect to circle a few - or more - times.
3. CASH ONLY.
4. Prices are about $0.25 more expensive than the Sunset.
author: Gwen L.

description: Who doesn't love fresh-baked bread, cookies and sweets?  Five stars, of course... but the REAL champion is the house-made chai.  Delicious!  Perfect with a dollop of honey and a dash of cinnamon.  Also quite caffeinated.  I approve.
author: icka b.

description: Why did you open right around the block from where I live Arizmendi?!?! Now I will get fat from all your deliciousness!!!
author: Keika L.

description: All of the liberal/hipster trappings of a trendy SF establishment.  Food is decent and cheap.
author: Danny C.

description: Iove the new location.  Free samples today - try the sourdough pizza :) brioche is excellent too
author: Katherine B.

description: love this place (like i love all arizmendis and the cheeseboard).  this place definitely has a lot more vegan options than other locations.  everything is yummy as always!
author: Helen T.

description: Today while in the midst of a long walk, my pal Jono and I stopped here to rest.  We bought a delicious crispy flavorful cheese roll and sat for a while.  While we were sitting, we got samples of wheat bread, sourdough bread, pizza, and 2 kinds of shortbread.  For about a dollar each we were very happily fed.  It was a relaxing environment and there was ample seating.  It was friendly and not snobby at all.  I will DEFINITELY be coming back often.  I heart new businesses when they are a good addition to the neighborhood.  YAY!
author: Julia D.

description: It's been 2 months and I'm still thinking about the X-Roll I had at Arizmendi on a recent trip to San Fran.  Gorgonzola, sun dried tomatoes, and arugula all wrapped up in the most delicious baked good I've ever tasted.  Ever.  Went back the next day and they had a different X-Roll...also amazing.  Everything in the bakery looked so tempting.  I will definitely go back next time I'm in SF.
author: Amanda D.

description: I'm afraid to say that I'm not in love yet with this long-awaited bakery. The cherry cornmeal scone is a great idea, although I'd prefer it to be a bit more moist. The muffins I've had here are also a bit underwhelming. Both seem a bit on the dry side... almost as if they're overcooked. Next up, I'll try the legendary pizza.
author: Ryan L.

description: Arizmendi has THE BEST CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES that exist.  The Valencia Street ones are even better than the 9th Avenue ones.  They always have a vegan foccacia (their leak, mushroom, and artichoke was FANTASTIC).  They give pizza slices and always give an extra little slice (which 9th Avenue doesn't do).  When their pizzas have feta cheese, they're so very delicious.
author: Anya R.

description:
Some good bread and good pastries, but I think the Cheeseboard (in Berkeley, which has many of the same items) does them better.  For instance, I *love* the cornmeal cherry scones, but they seem to be a bit sparse with fruit at this bakery.  I find myself looking for the next cherry and not always finding it so easily.  Same goes for the fruit in the wolverines--sparing.  Not so out in Berkeley.

The pecan rolls (or whatever they call them) are seriously delicious.  I've been less excited about many of the muffins, one of which I almost spat out.  Some of the breads are good, but I don't know that I would make a special trip here.  The pizzas can be good and a nice treat if walking by, but again, nothing super special.
author: Casey P.

description: Walked in and had some great brussels sprouts/smoked mozzarella/balsamic pizza. Fresh made and not too expensive. All the baked goods looked delicious. Good for a day at Dolores.
author: Lynn A.

description: While I was waiting for my sidekick to scoop me up on the way to Dolo Park last week, I went in Arizmendi Bakery on Valencia and wanted to try their pizza of the day. It had kalamata olives, spinach, parmesan, and feta cheese on one slice! Man it was good and it hit the spot! I'd come back here again for a quick bite to eat!
author: Mika D.

description: When they first opened, I originally thought that the portions were small for the price. This has gotten better (pizza slices are more towards the normal size now). Also, I'm a big fan of the x-roll.
author: Danielle H.

description: Cheese rolls as good as ever.  Tallllll ceilings, bright and airy.
author: Melanie C.

description:
I'm so glad other people like this place.  But to me, the measure of a bakery is how good their bread is, not their cookies, pastries, or muffins.  Unfortunately, I am unable to tell anyone how their bread is -- because they don't bake in the morning!  I was told, quite snootily, when I went there at 7 to purchase a fresh loaf for the day, that they don't bake bread in the morning, that the first sourdough doesn't go in for an hour, and that they have other breads, but they go in later.  And the attitude was as if I should have known that. 

Well, to me, if a bakery doesn't have BREAD, it is not a bakery, it is a patisserie -- a pastry shop.  I bought nothing there and don't plan to, ever.  Their website also doesn't mention that they are closed on Tuesdays, nor does it mention this odd bread baking schedule.  I wish someone would open a good BAKERY in the 24th street Mission area.
author: Sean N.

description: I am within ear shot of this bakery. Needless to say I was excited to see this place finally open. But I've tried most if not all the pastries, and nothing has really wowed me. It's a hit n miss, some of the pastries tend to be dry and not as sweet as I would like. I do like the "house" pizzas. That's about it. I would like to see croissants, pies and cakes added to their menu selection.
author: lola s.

description: Consistent and delicious - this place brings it! They have the BEST blueberry corn muffins (or just plain corn muffins) and excellent Brioche knots that work extremely well with a strong cup of coffee. Oh, and their pizza is always delicious and often vegetarian. The scones with fresh fruit are always nice too.
author: Vittorio L.

description:
This review has been updated. I'm leaving it intact as there is a takeaway here for both customers and business owners.

Original review:

It pains me to drop them to a 3, but not enough to not do it. I went last Saturday and ordered a couple slices, giving my name, Charles. Someone else ordered pizza as well. A few minutes later, the staffer serving the pizza put out a couple of slices and called out "Joseph." Then "Aaron" (Erin?). But no Charles.

There didn't seem to be anyone else waiting for pizza, so I asked if they meant Charles. The staffer said the two slices were the only order for two slices, so it must be mine. I retrieved the two slices and put my tip in the jar.

Let's be fair and say the slices were 4.5 stars, totally outstanding. Heirloom Tomato with Goat Cheese and fresh herbs. Deelicious. One of their best.

But "Joseph" is so far from "Charles" I wondered whether that was retaliation for not giving a tip at payment time. And no "I'm sorry" for the mistake either. That took some of the glow off the meal. 

Ironically, another place that uses numbers let me have the wrong number. But they went out of their way to find me and also apologized for the error.

"I'm sorry" is really important when you mess up. A lack of it gave me a bad association with this place, and that reduces my chances of returning, at least for a while.

Update:

Madeleine of Arizmendi wrote me to apologize. Apparently name mixups are not that unusual, so be aware if nobody seems to be claiming that pizza you are expecting to get but the name doesn't match. Anyway, they now realize it may be routine to them but not to the customer and are interested in customer service.

So I'm giving them back their star. Thanks, Madeleine. Looking forward to more of that luscious Arizmendi pizza.

Takeaway for customers:

What may seem like a slight may merely be a service glitch. Lighten up and enjoy your meal.

Takeaway for owners:

What may be a service glitch may be taken as a slight. Apologizing can keep a customer.
author: Charles B.

description: I love the idea that they are a co-op bakery and are local, but I seriously wish their muffins and other products were a bit less sickly sweet, and that they offered more whole wheat options- in both breads and pastries. Also, they are just way too expensive! But, given that they are on Valencia, it's about what you'd expect. I'm totally a fan of the fact that they make some tasty vegan bread-products though!
author: Amanda S.

description: I love daily pizza and the breadsticks. Also order a very awesome ginger tea cake. I would avoid the chocolate round pastry--don't remember what it's called. It's dry and not very good. Otherwise, this is a pretty solid bakery.
author: Helen L.

description:
I stepped into this establishment on a lovely Saturday afternoon wreaking of the previous nights debauchery. The girlie (berkeley girl/cheeseboard fanatic) insisted this be our Saturday evening meal. I picked up a premade artichoke and spinach pie at the fair price of $20. The service was quick and efficient, I even rang them back a little later just to double check the prepartion instructions (throw in the oven and heat).  Like I said courteous and efficient. 
The pizza was delish. I'm an east coast boy and have high regards for my apizza. Relatively thin crust, tasty ingrediants with a unique intersection of flazors, perhaps even citrusy at times... Granted I'm told the pies change daily. Perhaps its the traditionalists in me that pondered how this would taste with a little gravy (red sauce) underneath, although thats not for me to decide. Go with Arizmendi for a deliouscious experience. Their baked goods looked bomb also. Mint chocolate chip muffins... Getthafuckouttahere.
author: Daniel C.

description: Vegan options are amazing!  Prices are reasonable for what you are getting and staff is nice.  Closed on Tuesdays!
author: K W.

description: This place rocks! The best pizza ever (really, EVER), and the freshest baked goods. Good for breakfast, lunch and dinner! My personal favorite of SF.
author: l o.

description: Their pizza is amazing. I lived two blocks away; it was deadly. Every time I walked by, I wanted to grab a slice. Some pizzas are better than others, for sure, so make sure you check the menu before you go if you're picky. However, it tastes very fresh, and the prices are more than reasonable.
author: Aseem P.

description: I'm addicted to this place, the scones are the best I've ever had. They only have one kind of pizza a day which is kind of annoying because whatever they do have is so damn good you just wish there were more options. I've had about 5 or 6 different slices and they were all great. $2.50 for a "gourmet" slice is hard to beat. I've never had anything from here that I wasn't really happy eating.
author: Matthew R.

description: I've been meaning to go to Arizmendi for quite a while, and finally did- not disappointed! Arizmendi is just THE BEST. Everything I've gotten there so far- daily pizza, pastries, fantastic loaves of bread- has been incredibly good. Atmosphere is nice, cool, and the workers are really nice, friendly and accommodating. If I lived closer, I'd be there all the time!
author: JOHN S.

description: I come here everyday. Great scones, muffins, coffee, all picked up quickly on my way to work. Interesting and creative pizzas (in a good way!)-- I find myself bringing people here all the time. Very friendly staff. Good spot for people who appreciate things that are labeled with care, also (gluten-free, vegan, etc.). They also provide these options without sacrificing anything. Amazing peanut butter cookies. Cooperatively run, also, which is something I'm always happy to support.
author: Leah M.

description: pizza connoisseur, and this is one of the BEST IVE EVER HAD! the cookies? THE BEST IVE EVER HAD! :D woo hoo!
author: Chris F.

description: Rustic? How about "made for cowboys" and no that is not a compliment. If I wanted bland and hearty I can mix up flour and water and pop it in the oven myself. When I go to a bakery I want something that takes a little more effort. Rustic != Tasty
author: Gregg T.

description: best bakery in the neighborhood! everything there is so cheap and delicious! there are so many vegan options. i go there at least once a day. and the pizza is always amazing!
author: Katy O.

description: pizzas start at 11:30 am.  everything here is great.  of course, you know the scones.  try the X roll.  a savory cheese roll with toppings--the texture and taste, so good.
author: Rob C.

description: Love this bakery! Cherry corn meal scone is my favorite but the currant scone is close behind! Closed on Tuesday's but I guess I can deal with that. OMG I just love this place! Get your HOT carbs here!!!
author: V M.

description: I'm so glad this place is open at long last! Though, compared to the Cheeseboard in Berkeley, I'm used to getting the couple of extra slices with the whole pizza. Today's pizza may just be cheese, tomatoes, and peppers, but man was it hearty, if not amazing. However, I will be back many times, I'm sure.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
They started giving bigger slices (or extra slivers) and it turns out their baked stuff is great. The workers at Arizmendi's are really lovely and kind. And it's a coop. You really can't go wrong.
I hope they never close.
author: Sandy B.

description: They have the best scones I have ever tasted. The apple one specifically is my favorite. They only have one pizza special of the day and you can tell they use only fresh ingreds. I think it's $20 for an entire pie but worth the splurge if you're in the mood for a unique gourmet tasting pizza.
author: Janel H.

description: I can only say that at 12ish on a gray saturday afternoon that the pizza was amaazing! It was a onion and gorgozola walnut and balsamic pizza and it was like a deconstructed french onion soup whatever they were smoking to figure out the perfect savory afternoon treat well keep on keeping on because that was the best, the pizza is smaller than a normal slice and not as cheesy, which I find much nicer and makes more sense when the bread is of a higher quality and the slicers are cheaper! I m almost afraid to go back and try another flavor of the day as this was one of the best pizza slices I've ever but then again how could I resist?
author: crystal j.

description: I don't know if I am blessed (or cursed) to live around the corner from Arizmendi in the Mission.  I have become an oat scone addict (limiting myself though to one every other week.)  The pizza is killer, the cheese rolls divine. While I love Tartine, I find the slightly less hipster "seen and be seen" attitude of this place to be more my style.
author: Beth J.

description: This place was just so good. There were so many delicious baked goods, we could not hold back! We ate the cheesy roll, some special focaccia, a chocolate chip cookie, and the vegan berry scone. Everything was outstanding! Wow! Also, we were so impressed with how many vegan items they served. The staff was super friendly, and this was a delightful experience to say the least. Thanks for everything!
author: Sherri S.

description: Wow...the Asiago cheese rolls are excellent.  I tired them in the early evening and it's was a little hard, but still very delicious.  I love the cheese flavor.
author: Ricky M.

description: As part of our Friday Food Adventure, we were cruising the Mission and we saw a line formed at the site of the soon-to-be open Arizmendi's on Valencia. Of course we stopped and went in line. SCORE! They were giving samples of their delicious pastries. I got a onion something roll and a mini slice of their pizza. Sofa king good! I'll be writing another review when they open up. Thank you God for Arizmendi's opening up closer to me.
author: Ivan F.

description:
Excellent through and through! Delicious and fresh pastries, rich and flavorful pizza unlike anywhere else, and incredibly interesting, efficient, friendly and knowledgeable staff. You really get a community vibe in here--it seems like it has been {or should have been} in the neighborhood for years already. It's also a nice alternative to Tartine, in terms of bakeries in the Mission. While nothing beats Tartine's tarts, cakes, etc.. Arizmendi feels like a healthier, less indulgent, yet equally tasty option, without the massive Tartine lines. 

I can't praise this place enough!
author: Sara D.

description:
Great pastries and baked goods fast.

My biggest problem is going there and choosing either sweet or savory and then regretting having not chosen the other path.
author: Stephan M.

description:
It's so wonderful to have an Arizmendi in our neighborhood! Of course, it means more butter in our life, which could go either way.

But Arizmendi's baked goods are so tasty - buttery, cheesy, chewy, delightful.
author: Michael K.

description:
Just tried the pizza here recently, and is was excellent.  Got the lite-baked one to finish at home...This place reminds me of the Cheeseboard in Berkeley (also a co-op), so I'm glad I can get an excellent pizza near my neighborhood.

Will certainly return for all my pizza and bread needs.
author: Roxie B.

description:
I felt the adrenaline rush of fear and excitement when I heard Arizmendi was opening in the 'hood.  Fear because I knew I couldn't resist; excitement because I knew I couldn't resist.  I'm in the honeymoon period right now, but I hope to reduce to three visits a week.

Their sweet items are not too sweet, but I still prefer the savory:  cheese roll, pumpkin-chili roll, rosemary-sourdough, focaccias, zampano.  I love anything made with their sourdough starter.  Seems like they removed the millet muffin, which was my fave of their sweet things: crunchy goodness with raisin surprises.  

Their pizza needs advice from the Sunset branch: be more generous with the garlic oil.  The frugal oil amounts here may make them healthier, but for the cost of being less flavorful.

Signage could be improved: it's hard to read some of the handwritten signs.  A darker pen and larger, neater writing would help.  After they iron out a few blips, this will be the best bakery and pizza place in the area.
author: Sumomo O.

description:
Thank you for opening in the mission!  Your bread no longer has to be a treat when I make my way to the sunset.  
Was so thrilled to buy a sourdough roll today and get home having it still warm and soft inside.
author: J E.

description: Great addition to Valencia corridor. The pizza slices are excellent.
author: Daniel N.

description: I've only ever done takeout pizza -- they give it to you half-baked, and then you do the rest in your oven.  This pizza is frigging SENSATIONAL, people.  Wow.   And now I'm reading the reviews, I'm clearly going to have to try the baked goods as well.
author: Sarah B.

description: Love arizmendies, always a treat. I always go for the chocolate thing and the pizza. I would eat here every day if I was in the area. Incredible pizza.
author: caramel c.

description: Don't come here for service, just the amazing scones . The ppl at the front need serious ppl service skills, I went for the first time solely on yelp reviews. Also because I wanted to support the bakery that has donated to the Janet Pomeroy Center (a center for children and adults with developmental disabiities) which I have worked for. I figure I wanted to support them by making them a regular....yea that changed with the rude lady at the front who sounds like a total dude btw. I bought several scones and breads and she had the nerve to look at each in the bag! Like wth? lady, do you think I lied or something when I told her exaclty what I grabbed???, then I told her I wanted a receipt for my large purchase, and she didnt give me one. Then I asked if it was self serve coffee since it was my first time and I was confused, and she basically gave me a look of "WTF? dont you see the coffee right there???" So I gave up with this hell in a handbasket and asked the nice girl behind the counter making speciality drinks. She was nicer and made me my latte after I had to tell them twice for it, since Big Shoulder Maggie ignored me and didnt even give my order. Based on this experience I wll definitely not be a regular, and will not spread word of mouth about them. Unless I am in dire, desperate need for a scone orgasm, I problably wouldnt make the trip again! I have had waaayyy better service at Martha and Bros on Cortland than here, not worth the drive.
author: Christina M.

description: I go here almost every morning and am never disappointed. Only once on a busy day did they get my pizza order mixed up, but other than that it's been smooth sailing, which deserves 5 stars. Sometimes I just come in for coffee which they run out of really fast, but that's okay, it's really good coffee!! My favorite things to get here are the wheat-free carrot muffin, which doesn't seem that popular compared to the other pastries, but i have had them all and this one is the BEST!! I also love the riccarelli cookie, an almondy sticky cookie with powdered sugar on top - omg!!! Everything else is delicious, too, but these are my personal favs. The staff is really kind and patient. I also love that this place is a co-op - seems like everyone enjoys their job and is having fun :) The atmosphere is a large, open, clean space. I like when i come in and they're playing hip hop, but they keep it pretty mixed with the music they play. My favorite bakery and breakfast spot! The pizza is good, too, but breakfast is my meal of choice here.
author: Caitlin V.

description: So excited to see Arizmendi open in the 'hood. But I have to say that I was disappointed in my purchase yesterday--my scone and cookie were both pretty dry. Hope this was just an opening day issue and that the quality improves over time!
author: J L.

description: I recently discovered this worker owned co-op bakery when they put this location in (apparently there are a few others scattered around the city) and I am totally hooked on their scones and goodies. The daily fruit scone is always delicious, and the cherry/corn meal scone is wicked good! Also check out these little mexican named cookies (starts with an "r" ). They are almond flavor, crusty on the outside, soft inside, dusted with powdered sugar pieces of heaven. Outstanding!! Haven't tried their more savory goods yet, but everything we've had has been amazing, so I'm sure that the pizzas are great too. Note that this isn't a place to go hang out, but rather pick up and go (few tables around, but not really a chill out place; not sure about the other locations); we recommend dropping by to pick up these goodies and then cruise down the street to Ritual to get your coffee on and head home to enjoy!!
author: Artina M.

description: they have a really unique array of baked goods that changes daily. props to their bread pudding, fresh fruit scones, and of course the pizza, though everything there is delicious. the staff is friendly and patient even when there's a line going out the door
author: Monika S.

description: Carb heaven. This worker owned cooperative also has a location by 9th and Irving St. Compared to the tiny location by 9th, this has it's huge doors open and huge windows that give enough natural light inside. Roomy atmosphere with a coupe of tables to sit at, and the chance to see them bake from the back. This bakery has baguettes, baked goods, pastries, and pizza! They have an amazing selection of different baked goods and sweets such as; corn meal cherry scones,  vegan banana nut muffins, pecan rolls, cookies, granola and muffins. They also serve great pizza. Each day they serve a different pizza, which is served right out of the oven 11:30AM, you can check their daily menu on their website calendar. Through out the day they'll bake new ones, but I suggest you go early so it's hot and fresh. Usually their pizza base is a thin sourdough crust with mozzarella. Although they don't add meat to any of their toppings, carnivores can use this opportunity to try a good vegetarian pizza. Not that I am one but they even offer vegan baked goods and sweets too.  You can buy slight baked pizzas to go so you can finish baking them your self. I believe the 9th and Irving location does their pizza slightly better, but their baked goods are just as good. So next time if you want a 1 2 punch carb combo of pizza for lunch and a scone for dessert, try Arizmendi!
author: Shane M.

description: I've hit this place four times already, and in spite of the inescapable hype, I've really taken to it. There appear to be a few early wrinkles to be ironed out -- the cheese roll I had was a bit dry, and the jalapeno-cheese loaf I got a few days ago was undercooked -- but on other visits I've had nothing but winners in the cherry corn scone, currant scone, and shortbread. The olive bread was an unexpected delight; it was rockin' some moist, flavor-bursting olives that really elevated the loaf of bread into a standalone treat.
author: Eugene P.

description: Lots of creative breadloaf concoctions here.
author: Matthew K.

description: Delicious scones, delicious scones! I love going to Arizmendi on a slow weekend morning. However, I do wish they would step up their pizza toppings. I find Cheeseboard (their step-sister collective in Berkeley) to have consistently tastier and more interesting pizza topping combos. If you go to Arizmendi- do expect great pastries, nice folks and a community feel- also you might get a pizza with walnuts, gorgonzola and onions. Where're the tasty veggies, guys?! Also, they really need to add more seating. Four tables is just not enough for the crowds in the morning.
author: Kika S.

description: amazing food, reasonable prices. It can get crowded at lunch and dinner (they have a limited amount of tables and only 1 cashier open at any given time) it never takes more then a 10 minutes to grab your snack, pay and be on your way.
author: Nicola A.

description: The pastries I tried were incredibly bland. The "chocolate thing" was bread-y and lacking flavor, like a 59¢ sandwich roll you might get from a Safeway bakery with chocolate bits added in. I don't see how I could ever come back here when Tartine is a short walk away.
author: Matt B.

description: this is hands down my absolute favorite bakery in the city. so darn good. decent prices. they have amazing scones with juicy pieces of fruit, delicious fresh breads, yummy pizza. i dont know what else you could want... except for maybe a few more tables. but this is about the co-op and the product, not really a "dining experience." in that regard, different from tartine for sure- expect much shorter lines, lower prices and a more intriguing line up.
author: Felicia B.

description: once again, doesn't live up to my favorite the Cheese Board in berkeley!!!   recent visit had good topping but burned crust/dough!!!   so disappointing
author: suzanne e.
